text: An engraved brass plaque announcing the name of the "priv banking institute" within.

JAMES BOND, dressed impeccably as ever, is being FRISKED three THUGS in Armani suits.  They remove A GUN from insi his jacket, a well-concealed knife, a metal case, laying on the desk that separates Bond and... LACHAISE...an extremely well-groomed gentleman. Behind hi three floor-to-ceiling windows lead out to a rooftop gard
Not the usual Swiss procedure, Mr. Bond, but you understand, a man in my position..

Which is neutral, no doubt. Lachaise takes the joke a little tight-lipped.  Gestures Bond to sit. A GIRL ENTERS, a gorgeous Swiss bombshell in a pin-stripe suit.  She pushes a cart. On it are a BRIEFCASE and a box EXPENSIVE CIGARS, which she offers to Lachaise and Bond.

It wasn't easy, but I retrieved the money.  No doubt Sir Robert will be pleased to see it again. The efficient Cigar Girl brings the briefcase to Bond, setting it in his lap and opening it up...inside is a goo deal of CASH in pound sterling.
In the current exchange rate, minus the fees, of course, and certain unforeseeable expenses. Here is the receipt... The CIGAR GIRL offers Bond a RECEIPT...
Would you like to check my figures?
Perhaps later. She steps back. Bond reaches for the metal case on the desk...the THUGS TENSE...
My glasses. Lachaise nods.  Bond can have his glasses. He puts them on, gives a cursory look at the receipt...an number in pound sterling, calculated down to the penny: 3,030,303.03.
It's all there. Bond folds the receipt, slips it into his WALLET...then, removes the glasses, slowly, deliberately, eyeing Lachais
I didn't come for the money. The report you sold him was stolen from an MI-6 agent, who was killed for it. He takes a photo from his jacket and lays it on the desk.
I did not get the report from an MI-6 agent.
Who did you get it from?
I am just a middle man. I am doing the honourable thing and returning the money to its rightful owner...
And we know how difficult that can be for the Swiss.
(controlled fury)
Your last chance. Take the money.
Your last chance. Give me the name.
Stripped of all your weaponry, you still threaten me? He nods.  An Armani thug steps up and takes out a gun...

Perhaps you failed to take into account my...hidden assets. Bond's mouth edges into a smile.  A flicker of doubt on Lachaise's face -- as Bond's finger finds a protrusion on tiny arm of his glasses and... KABOOM!  The pistol on the table FLASHES...blinding those around, they cover their eyes, stagger back...it is a bri effect, just enough to disorient the thugs and give Bond opening... He KARATE-CHOPS HENCHMAN #1 unconscious, taking his gun. Kicks HENCHMEN #2 in the face and throws #3 OUT THE WINDO just as they're getting their bearings.  Now he nestles t barrel of his borrowed hand gun into the hollow of Lachai cheek.
The name?
I can't tell you... (Bond cocks the gun)

Alright, alright! But you must protect me! And he freezes.  The handle of a THROWING KNIFE is sticki out of his neck.  Bond looks up, catches sight of the CIG GIRL as she vaults out the broken window and onto THE ROO Bond rushes to the window...

She swings on a WIRE across to another roof, quickly disappearing into shadows. Bond can hear sirens approaching. He returns to... THE OFFICE...he grabs the money and moves fast for the do casually slipping that cigar into his pocket... Except Henchman #1 has recovered, blocks his way, gun in hand.  He starts to squeeze the trigger -- when a RED DOT appears on his chest...another window SHATTERS as a bulle zings through and pierces the henchman in the heart. Bond looks back once at the shattered window, then heads

Bond appears on the top floor of the grand old building, the elevator.  Looks over the balcony, sees figures on th stairs.  Hears the elevator cage start from below. Thinking fast, he wrenches open the steel gate, leans int the lift shaft, watches the elevator COUNTERWEIGHT as it comes down.  Almost nonchalant, he steps out...
As the cageful of police rises, Bond is now standing on t counterweight, DESCENDING.
Lunchtime.  Faceless business crowds heading for their br moment of freedom, among them we spot BOND...one of them, with a briefcase and a suit and tie...HOLD on his face, troubled.

The Cigar Girl enters a huge, high-ceilinged room. Edgy, approaches a BIG MAN standing on a balcony overlooking th city.  Propped against the doorframe, an assassin's RIFLE with LASER-SIGHT attached. BINOCULARS are on a tripod, trained on the rooftop below where we can see cops examin the shattered office windows. The man turns. Powerful, deadly, with a military haircut. There is a raised, red scar of an ENTRY WOUND at his temp It throbs and shifts with the slightest facial expression like an insect living just beneath his skin. One EYE seem slightly drooping, deadened. The other eye is sharp and b as anthracite.  It is a frightening face. This is RENARD.
What's his name? Our friend from MI-6?
James Bond.
One of M's more accomplished tin soldiers.
He could identify me.
If it concerns you...kill him. He touches her cheek and moves into the room, pouring two glasses of wine.
Let's toast this James Bond.  We're in his hands now...
A SEAPLANE swoops over the Millennium Dome, banks along t snaking river.
Tate Gallery in background, the seaplane moors beneath th vast stepped cake that is MI-6.  Bond exits with the suitcase.

CAMERA MOVES with Bond as he enters this secret, hi-tech world.  He passes through countless security procedures, watched by an attentive staff. Bond scoops the money out of the suitcase.  Three million sterling in tightly bundled hundreds makes quite a sight. flicks his finger through the last wad, tosses it down wistfully.  A blue light scans it on three axis. The money is bundled into a clear plastic bag, put on a t and wheeled through a series of barred enclosures into th SECURE ROOM.  Bond hands the suitcase to a STAFF MEMBER.
Have this checked, see what you can get off it.
Bond appears, hiding something behind his back.  Moneypen brightens.
James.  Brought me a souvenir from Geneva? He produces the cigar, now in a large phallic TUBE.  Stan it end up on the desk.
Thought you might want one of these.
(beat, deadpan)
I gave up a long time ago. (nods to M's door)
She's in with Sir Robert.
Bond enters.  SIR ROBERT KING is perched on the edge of M desk.  Two glasses, a bottle of scotch open.
Sir Robert King, James Bond. King moves toward Bond with an easy, patrician smile. Bon notes a TINY BADGE in his lapel -- like the glass eye of stuffed snake.

Thanks for getting my money back --never expected to see it again.  You're the kind of man I could use.  Though I won't offend certain parties by asking you to join King Industries. King looks to M, smiling.
Construction's not exactly my line.
Quite the opposite, in fact. She couldn't resist. King smiles at Bond.  As he goes, he gives M a respectful kiss on the cheek. The door closes. turns.
Old friend?
Since Oxford. I knew him when he had nothing but a brilliant mind and enough guts to conquer the world. He's a man of great integrity.
Who buys classified reports for three million pounds. M picks up the report from her desk.  Bond notices it is Russian, with a SEAL from a Russian military agency in th corner: MIRATOM.

It's a report on weapons security in the former Soviet Union, which, as you know, is shaky at best.  He's had several instances of sabotage at the pipeline, and he's understandably concerned. He called me the moment he realized its sensitive nature. She pours a scotch for Bond.  He drops some ice in, thoughtful.
Someone was watching over me in Geneva. A guardian angel with a laser sight. He stops, rubs his thumb and forefinger together -- a str SIZZLING where he touched the ice.  Realization sinks in.
King. M sees the seriousness in his eyes -- stabs at the interc
Moneypenny's eyes shoot to the intercom console:
(filtered)
Moneypenny, stop King leaving.
(flicking switch)
Security --
Sir Robert King and an MI-6 AIDE walk toward SECURITY.
Q and his men are working on a strange half-built BOAT suspended over a water tank.
..the hydro boat can operate in three inches of water... He looks up as Bond runs through...
THE MONEY lies on the tray, wrapped in plastic. Sir Robert approaches, two rows of security bars between and the cash.  An official produces a bag and moves towar it:
Thanks, but I'll count it myself. (apologetic, smiles)
Lifetime habit.  I'm Scottish.
Bond shoots around the corner just in time to see Sir Rob disappearing past the THICK STEEL DOOR of the secure room
Stop!  King!
The shout is muffled, Sir Robert's more interested in the money. He continues toward camera, that PIN on his lapel emits a serene HUM and we

head_text.subj: THE METAL STRIP IN ONE NOTE AS IT CRACKLES AND -

text: MAYHEM.  FIRE blasts out of the open doorway just as Bond reaches it.  The STEEL DOOR flies toward him.  He dives -
The building rocks.  SMOKE is pouring from a HOLE that's appeared in a lower tier. A wall and a section of roof go
A figure staggers out, shaken.  Catching his breath.  BON
Lining up Bond with her infra-red telescopic sight.

In the swirling dust and smoke, he suddenly sees a wand o red light, pointing at his chest. All instinct, he dives for cover.  Powerful, high velocit bullet hits blanket the area.  Bond prepares to return fi scanning around for the source. Through the debris he spo an unusual, hi-tech BOAT on the river -- long and narrow low.  A figure on board.  THE CIGAR GIRL.
She FIRES OFF A ROUND OF SHOTS, forcing Bond back into co Then she guns the engines and SPEEDS OFF down the Thames.
Determined, Bond races back into the wreckage...
Bond races through the chaos that is MI-6 and into...
Where he leaps into the prototype BOAT.  Q protests...
It's not finished! Bond looks at the mystifying number of buttons and gadget ...presses something red and...THE BOAT LEAPS OUT, ENGINE ROARING...
JAMES BOND, in the Q boat, SHOOTS OUT of the MI-6 rubble onto the Thames.
Bond can see the Cigar Girl up ahead...he is closing the distance.  She catches sight of him in pursuit...
She pushes the boat to its limit, it roars to a new level speed...the chase is on.
Police speedboats, alerted by the commotion, trail Bond.
Police cars scream alongside, sirens wailing.
Bond is losing ground as he and the Cigar Girl weave thro traffic on the Thames. In a gutsy bid to keep pace, he corrals the Q boat into a hair-raising SHORT-CUT, shootin off...
He maneuvers the boat under the low pier and emerges EVEN CLOSER to his prey...
The Cigar Girl stops her boat, moving to the back, mannin her large, rear-mountain MACHINE GUN and taking aim at Bond...
Bond continues at full speed, fearless in the hail of bul ricocheting off the vessel. THE CIGAR GIRL Remains calm and cool, shooting with precision. BOND closes in... CIGAR GIRL'S eyes widen as...

head_text.subj: BOND STEERS HIS BOAT RIGHT OVER THE MACHINE GUN AND TURRE

text: Cigar Girl dives out of the way, as her boat becomes a RA LAUNCHING the Q boat INTO THE AIR before it dives, nose- first, into the Thames.
CIGAR GIRL gets up from the deck and sees BOND, turning h boat to close in for the kill... She scrambles to the helm and SPEEDS OFF, seeing ahead of her...
Just beginning to open, to allow for passage of a small tanker.
She streaks toward the bridge, Bond lagging behind...
As he looses her boat in the distance, he makes a DESPERA MOVE...he cranks the wheel of his boat and veers off, UP SLIPWAY and into...
Where the boat hydroplanes on masses of surface water and propels him into
The hurtling boat causes mayhem and panic as he wrestles the controls, jetting off the street and straight toward.
Bond's boat crashes right through it, sending diners LEAP in every direction. The Q boat SHOOTS OUT over the balcon and splashes down once more into...

Cigar Girl is now clearly in his sights.  She is amazed t see that Bond has managed to overtake her. The racing boats dice through an armada of lazy, over-loa BARGES, nearly crashing into the much larger vessels. AT EVEN PACE NOW...Cigar Girl attempts to force her way p him, but Bond, punching buttons on the console of the Q-b releases a set of catapulting FLAME CANNISTERS which crea massive WALL OF FIRE ahead of them... CIGAR GIRL is forced toward the very edge of the river... jig is almost up, and then... HER P.O.V.  She spots the launching of a HOT AIR BALLOON the base of the massive MILLENNIUM DOME. She skids her vessel to a stop at a nearby pier and quick scrambles out of her boat.

...A crowd around a RICHARD BRANSON-like figure about to climb into his HOT AIR BALLOON. The Cigar Girl, brandishing her gun, forces her way throu the crowd and LEAPS INTO THE BALLOON CARRIAGE, just ready lift off.  She cranks open the gas nozzles and the balloo rises with surprising speed.
Bond steers his craft toward a slipway adjacent to the pi and SHOOTS UP INTO THE AIR...

An amazing sight...Bond's boat sailing through the air ju beneath the balloon.  With split second precision he reac up and GRABS ONE OF THE ROPES dangling down from the ball Bond finds himself being CARRIED THROUGH THE AIR as his b falls away from him, hitting the ground and ERUPTING into ball of flame.

As Bond is carried higher and higher, the Cigar Girl begi FIRING AT HIM over the edge of the carriage. Bond, with ONE HAND, returns fire. CIGAR GIRL then leans over the edge of the carriage and begins to SLICE THE ROPE that Bond is hanging from. The fibers split and fray away from each other as... BOND FALLS, heading straight toward... THE MILLENNIUM DOME, which the balloon has drifted over. AS HE PLUMMETS DOWNWARD...Bond, never surrendering, still FIRES HIS WEAPON up at the balloon. A bullet hits the gas tank...
The BALLOON EXPLODES IN A MASSIVE FIREBALL taking the Cig Girl with it...
Bond lands with a spectacular thudding bounce, the roof o the Millennium Dome breaking his fall.
He slides uncontrollably down the slope of the Dome as sc of burning balloon rain down all around, before he FALLS THE EDGE of the Dome and lands with a THUD ON...
He struggles up, wincing in SEARING PAIN as his hand goes his INJURED SHOULDER. He hold it, and looks up, into the as we zero in on the iris of...
reflecting the massive smoke cloud from the explosion as screen transforms into...

BAGPIPES.  A chapel atop a green slope overlooking the wa of Loch Lomond. A long line of mourners files out at the end of a memoria service.  They mill about on the lawn, among them,  M, gr faced, BILL TANNER, CHIEF OF STAFF and JAMES BOND, his ar a black sling. Bond, ever vigilant, scans the crowd... HIS P.O.V.  It's like a state funeral.  Rich and powerful people, government ministers, chief executives from aroun the world...and then... FAR OFF, on a DISTANT RISE, he sees a BIG MAN, not one of mourners but an isolated observer, standing alone, wearin sunglasses and a military haircut. The man seems to see Bond looking at him...
Bond, we'll meet you inside. Bond looks at her for a brief second...when he turns back the man is gone, like an APPARITION. Bond walks off, up the grassy slope, toward the rise.

Bond stands on the hill, looking below.  He sees nothing a green carpet, not a tree to hide behind. He hears a crunch of leaves...turns... HIS P.O.V.  A WOMAN, in mourning black, coming up the hil Her china doll face is both fragile and proud.
Beautiful, isn't it?
Yes. She steps up to the ridge with him.  A breeze blows her h They stare out. The sun's rays have broken the clouds and strafe the valley.
Today, of all days, the sun decides to shine.
Perhaps Sir Robert had a word with the Man Upstairs.
A word? I'm sure by now he's engineered a hostile takeover.
You knew him well? The sun glints off her bejewelled earlobe.
He was my father.
I'm sorry.
He died before he could complete his lifelong dream. (beat)
I intend to finish it for him. A voice interrupts them, calling from the estate...
Elektra!
Excuse me. She walks away, the wind pressing her dress against her delicate figure.  She looks brave and vulnerable as she w back toward her father's grand house.
M, Bond and Tanner in the rear of a limousine. The vehicl swoops through the epic countryside of the Scottish Highlands.
Elektra?  Running King Industries? (she broods)
I've known that girl all her life. I'm not sure she knows what she's walking into.
She's not a girl anymore. M looks at Bond. Eyes his sling.
I've scheduled a medical for you.
It's barely a scratch. The Dome broke my fall.
Well, at least it turned out to have some purpose. Bond gives her a look.
No-one goes into the field on this unless they're 100%.  Dr. Greatrex is waiting.
The limousine swoops under the portcullis, into a courtya ADJUST ANGLE to reveal huge antennae and satellite dishes within.
Bond walks through the corridors.  Just before he enters medical room, he removes his sling and casually drapes it a suit of armor.
Bond sits on the couch, shirt off, awaits the results of medical. The very attractive DOCTOR GREATREX looks at her notes.
Dislocated collar bone.  If any more tendons snap... (looks up)
It won't just be two weeks out of action.
I need you to pass me fit now, Molly. She moves to him, touches the scarred and bruised bone.
It's just a scratch.
James.  It wouldn't really be... His hand comes up, rests on her waist.

Ethical?  Can't we just skirt the issue? And he pulls down the zip on her skirt.  Flicks the clasp it drops to the floor.  She shakes her head -- as he star undoing the buttons on her shirt.  She's very business-li despite what's happening.
...if you showed sufficient...willpower. Promised to slow down.  Cut out running, jumping...shooting.  All kinds of... And he pulls her toward him, they kiss.
Strenuous activity? Her shirt drops to the floor.  She pushes him back, lies him.  Just wearing knickers now.  Between kisses:
Then maybe I'd be... open to that.
(smiles)
Perhaps after this ... test?
I could come for a second opinion?

A huge chandelier dominates the vast stone room. SEVERAL AGENTS listen to the debriefing.  ROBINSON and M watch TA explain things; he holds a FIFTY POUND NOTE and KING'S LA PIN (now blackened, fused, melted to expose electronics beneath).

...The money was dipped in urea, dried, and packed tight. In one note the metal strip had been replaced with a combustible magnesium circuit -- in effect a tiny detonator. King always wore a pin in his lapel, an heirloom called 'the Eye of the Glens'; but someone switched it for a copy, a ceramic micro- circuit emitting an electronic signature.
on BOND as he enters the room.  He hangs back in the shad watches Tanner mime the pin moving to the note:
When he came within range of the money -- boom.  Ingenious. M steps forward.  Her fury controlled.
We've been pawns in someone's game. They tricked us into bringing the money to King. Not just elaborate.  Cock-sure.

And expensive.  Cost three million plus. Suddenly the chandelier darkens, the floor brightens into VAST SCREEN, showing a satellite image of Central Asia an the Mediterranean.  M and Robinson walk onto the screen.
Cheap, if it achieves your aim of de- stabilizing the Western World. She causes the desired stir.  Bond steps forward from the shadows to get a better view.  M sees the sling has gone.
007. What do you know of the Caspian Sea?
Caviar capital of the world. Matchless beluga. Firm, yet subtle. (M looks askance)
Largest landlocked body of water on Earth.  Oil-rich.  Hitler wanted it. Stalin beat him to it.
And now it's up for grabs, a goldrush. Far more oil than anyone thought.
Latest estimates, six trillion dollars. It'll make the Gulf look like a puddle, see us right through the new century. The problem is getting the oil out of there.
There are four pipelines in the works. Three to the Black Sea, shipping out through the Bosphorus. All vulnerable to unstable governments or Russian blockade.
So Sir Robert's goes through Turkey, direct to the Med...?

A huge project. The most expensive of the pipelines, but the one supported by every Western leader. None of the American oil companies were willing to take it on. But King has connections to the region. He married into the Vavra family, rich local industrialists. He used those connections to hold it all together.
Kill the man, kill the pipeline.
Not necessarily.  Not with Elektra taking over. Tanner notices a RED LIGHT start pulsing.  He moves to M:
Your call to the PM. M nods grimly.  As Robinson distributes sealed envelopes:
Our credibility has been hit hard.  We have to hit back harder. Your assignments. They open their envelopes, but Bond received nothing.
(to Bond)
I'm waiting for the report on your medical. She leaves.  Bond is brooding.

An ancient nook chock full of hi-tech equipment.  Bond concentrates on a screen displaying PHOTOGRAPHS, NEWSPAPE AND TELEVISION CLIPS -- all to do with King's life and ti Bond touches the screen on a photo of...ELEKTRA.
One story dominates -- the KIDNAPPING OF ELEKTRA KING. A Polaroid of Elektra savagely beaten, ear bandaged, holdin newspaper: beneath the photo is scrawled "$5,000,000."
...somehow managed to shoot two of her captors and escape... POLICE VIDEO: Elektra interviewed; bruised, emotional.
... the leader, the one who escaped.  Can you describe him?

He shouted.  He shouted all the time -- Bond touches Elektra's face, freezing her tears. His eyes wander to the photo with the ransom demand: $5,000,000.  A thought forms.  He takes out his wallet, opening it and removing: THE RECEIPT FROM LACHAISE. E.C.U. The strange figure, in pounds: 3,030,303.03. Bond taps some keys. The words EXCHANGE RATE appear on th screen...pounds to dollars. He enters '3,030,303.03 POUNDS STERLING' and through multiplication by the exchange rate this becomes: '5,000,000 US DOLLARS.'  He stares at it.
Bond paces the flagstones, FOOTSTEPS ECHOING.
Bond opens the door on M who stands alone by the window, looking out at the long shadows on the moors.
Tell me about the kidnapping of Elektra King. She turns, her brow furrowing.
Who told you to look at Elektra's files?
I took the initiative.
You haven't been given an assignment in this case.
I was the one who brought that money in...
I'm well aware of your stake in this, 007. If you have a point, get to it.
The amount of money that killed Robert King is the same amount as the ransom demand for Elektra. He hands her a slip of paper.
Whoever kidnapped Elektra is the same man who killed her father. M looks at the paper, a long time.
It's a message.  He wants us to know he's back.
Who?
Claude Serrault.  A.K.A...
(this is serious)
Renard.
A HUGE, TRANSPARENT 3-D IMAGE OF RENARD'S SKULL floats in centre of the room.  Other images of him on wall screens.
Sir Robert tried to deal with the kidnapping with his own...resources, at first. When Elektra's ear was delivered to him in the post, he came to me. (measured)
I advised against paying the ransom. I knew it was Renard. I played it out as long as possible to get a fix on him.
Sacrifice the girl to take out the terrorist?
How many deaths is he responsible for? How many innocent people? You may only get one shot at a man like Renard. Same circumstances, I'd do the same again. She turns to the hologram.
We sent 009 down to kill him.  Before he could, Elektra escaped.  A week later our man caught up with the target. Put a bullet in his head. (beat)
That bullet is still there. Bond moves toward the ghostly Renard. We now see THE BULL INSIDE HIS SKULL.
He survived?

The doctor who saved him couldn't get it out, so Renard killed him. When Interpol found the x-rays, there was mild jubilation. Effectively, he's a dead man. She presses a button, the hologram turns...
The bullet is moving through the medulla oblongata, killing off his sense of touch. He feels no pain. He can push himself harder, longer than any normal man.
'That which does not kill me makes me stronger.'
Now Robert is dead. He got his revenge.

He's not through yet. Renard doesn't blow up five million dollars unless he knows there's more coming in. He's working for someone. Someone who wants to stop the pipeline.  And they hired the perfect killer. One with a vendetta against King...and you. MONEYPENNY ENTERS with a file, which she hands to M. M looks over the file: his medical report.
I see the good doctor gave you glowing testimonials. 'Exceptional stamina'...
He's always been good at oral exams. Moneypenny disappears out the door. M is all business.

Get out to the pipeline. Find the insider who switched the pin. If your instincts are right, Renard will be back. He hasn't completed the job. The pipeline is still going forward, and we have Elektra to thank for that.
The worm on the hook again. They exchange a look. A look of recognition between two professionals, who know the terrible price of what they d

A Scot in a kilt plays the bagpipes -- badly.  He spins round, drops the pipe from his mouth, simultaneously fire bullets from one pipe and a jet of flame from another.  T target is a realistic dummy -- now a molten, bullet-ridde mess. We're in Q's laboratory.  He's walking Bond through.
Scottish heavy metal, Q?
Oh pipe down, 007. (irritated, hands over a WATCH)

Your 29th. Try not to lose this one. It has dual lasers and a miniature grappling hook with fifty feet of high-tensile micro-filament, able to support 800 pounds. In the background, we see a man in a sleek black jacket. man PULLS A STRING...the jacket becomes AN AIRBAG...it envelopes him, he gets impossibly tangled in it. Q ignores it, handing Bond a new pair of GLASSES.
New refinement.  Sort of X-ray vision. For checking concealed weapons.
And other uses, no doubt.

Abuses in your case. You destroyed my hydro-boat in less than seven minutes, as no doubt will be the case with this... He presses a button and a section of ceiling lowers to re a BMW Z7. A MAN in a white coat is loading A MISSILE into one of th headlamps, then steps off the platform.  Q gestures to hi
007, my Deputy Assistant.  I'm grooming him to follow me.
(to Man)
That would make you..."R"?
Ahh, the rampant 007 wit.  I, of course, am laughing inside.  But I dare say you've met your match in this machine. (touring the car)
The absolute latest in intercepts, surveillance and countermeasures. Titanium plating and armor, a multi- tasking heads-up display. Completely indestructible.  All in all, rather stocked.
'Fully loaded' I think is the term. "R" pats the fender, he's pretty damned fond of his machi
Do take good care of her.
A hot day. CAMERA soars over tall trees. We can just make the sleek muscular car, beetle-black and far below, bounc over rough terrain.  Bond "taking care" of his new BMW Z7
We join Bond at the wheel, driving hard, loving it, pushi up extreme inclines, smashing through overhanging limbs.

location: PERIMETER FENCE, CONSTRUCTION SITE, NEAR CAUCASUS

text: Bond reaches a PERIMETER FENCE, manned by a GUARD.  The g examines Bond's PASS and waves him through.

location: AIRSTRIP AREA NEAR CONSTRUCTION SITE, NEAR CAUCASUS

text: As Bond drives on he passes an area where HELICOPTERS trailing GIANT SAWS are trimming back trees.  Felled tree are being dragged away, being replaced by huge metal shee An incredibly fast and well-oiled operation -- but why?

Bond pulls up at the CONSTRUCTION SITE, teeming with ultr modern robotic construction machines and vehicles. He gets out, and is immediately surrounded by men with gu A man in a suit steps forward.  DAVIDOV is tall, blonde, a dangerous charm Bond instantly recognizes as ex-KGB. He turns Bond around, hands on the car.  Pats him down. Pulls out an ID, checks it:
(excellent English)
Bond. A government man. I'm afraid since you English got the boss killed we've been a little...jumpy. Bond stares ahead, watches a PRIVATE JET swoops past...

location: AIRSTRIP AREA NEAR CONSTRUCTION SITE, NEAR CAUCASUS

text: The jet lands on a runway of the metal sheets Bond saw be laid as he passed...
Davidov pulls out Bond's gun.
(re:  gun)
I'd rather you didn't play with that. Davidov ignores him, looking the gun over.
Nice.

Quite stunning. Bond turns to watch a LIFTING HELICOPTER swoop in and dro down an air-conditioned office.  Military precision. Davidov's radio crackles out a message and he tosses the back to Bond.  They start walking:
(pleasant)

Sorry about all that, comrade. Old habits die hard. I am Head of Security. Davidov. Bond eyes him, but is distracted by a jet coming to a hal ahead of them. Stairs swing down and out steps ELEKTRA KING.  Beautiful, elegant.  So out of place in this world of men.  She surv the worksite. Impressed, Bond takes his ID back from Davidov.

Bond and Davidov step into a fully functioning office. Everything Elektra requires is here. Computer, phones, dr cabinet. She is in the middle of a group of workmen and secretaries, looking at plans, talking, pouring herself a of coffee.
(to Foreman)
...they should have been in place two days ago. That is the target my father set.
We've had some trouble with the villagers at Ruan. Some sacred burial plot...
Miss King...James Bond here to see you. She looks up...a brief moment of RECOGNITION...then back business.
Find me the research on the limestone deposits, go ahead and place these orders, and get the jeep ready. I will go to Ruan myself...
Miss King, I wouldn't recommend...
I said, I will go. She signs some documents and the men file out. She gets u turning her back to Bond, hands on her hips.

Would you excuse us, Davidov? Davidov nods and leaves. Elektra still keeps her back tur but he can see her physically change, her shoulders sag, arms cross in front of her. When she finds her voice, it a gravelly sound of emotion.
I met you at my father's funeral.
Yes.
I haven't been able to recall a single moment of that day...until now.
Funerals aren't exactly memorable.
God no. All those horrible loved ones and relatives. I don't want to talk to those people. I just want to...talk to my father. (beat)
I loved him.  I'm not sure he knew that.
Is that why you want to finish the pipeline?
Partially, yes. Her muscleman BODY GUARD appears, says briefly:
The jeep is ready, Ma'am.  Will I be driving with you?
No, Gabor. We have a guest. Gabor glares at Bond before he leaves.
Who is he?
My bodyguard. He follows me everywhere. He's decisive, vigilant.  And he makes an excellent omelette.
How long has he been with you?
Since the kidnapping. Why do you ask? Bond takes something out of his pocket, he opens his palm shows it to her.
Does this look familiar to you?
It's my father's pin. He wore it everyday of his life. She swallows back emotion. Looks in his eyes, with a sad smile that unsettles him.
Are you trying to break my heart? Or is it just your way with women?
It's not the pin your father wore. It's an exact duplicate. Inside is a tiny electrical detonator. We have reason to believe the assassin had an inside accomplice, someone who worked at this company.
If you've come here to look after me, Mr. Bond, thank you, but no thank you.  I have two bodyguards, I don't need a third... She starts to walk out.  He follows her...
The killer doesn't want to see this pipeline continue, doesn't want to see you take over...
That's every man within a five mile radius.  Including you. (off his look)
That's why you're here, isn't it? You think I can't do it. You think I'm going to screw up. Or get myself killed.
I think running this pipeline would be a difficult job for anyone. Especially King's daughter.
You are wrong, Mr. Bond. In fact, I am the only person who can do it.

Elektra drives the all-terrain jeep with casual assurance Bond is beside her, cold-weather gear in the back.  They' following a huge pipeline, passing a blighted petrified forest of twisted iron:  derelict oil derricks. Elektra gestures at the oil fields they're now leaving behind.  Receding into the distance, a DELTA OF ROADWAYS perched on rusting stilts juts out into the sea.
My mother's people discovered oil here ninety years ago.  The Bolsheviks slaughtered them for it. (beat)

Some say oil is in my family's blood.  I say our blood is in the oil. This is the very heart of the planet.  Up here in the hills was Eden, literally.  Look what the Russians did to it.  Now we have a second chance and this time we'll do it right. When the other wells have all dried up, she'll still be pumping her lifeblood to the world.  And this (proudly, of pipeline)
Will be one of the main arteries...
Bond and Elektra travel beside the vast pipe through dramatic, beautiful, scenery...
Davidov and Gabor, in the helicopter, watch the jeep belo

location: CONSTRUCTION CAMP, FOOTHILLS OF THE CAUCASUS MOUNTAI

text: The jeep reaches a break in the pipe: a SURVEY CAMP, flag strings.  The SURVEY CREW cower behind a 4WD, local tribe are stoning them from a village carved into the rock.  A of SHOUTING. Before Bond can stop her, Elektra gets out, moves toward tribesmen.  The stoning ceases. They know who she is.  Sh begins to speak quietly -- in their own tongue.

A stunning pre-Byzantine chapel hewn from the rock.  Flam illuminate beautiful mosaics and paintings on the cavern wall.  A COPTIC PRIEST proudly shows Elektra about, jabbe in his mother tongue.  She answers in his language. Bond watches her, impressed.
We hear the click of high-powered electronic binoculars, zeroing in on Bond and Elektra as they return to the surv team.  This can't be Davidov's view, as the helicopter ha settled down below.
Bond is edgy.  Someone is out there.  He's sure of it.  H sees Davidov and Gabor scanning the area as well.  Elektr speaks to the foreman.
Send the pipe around.
It will take weeks, cost millions. Your father approved this route.
Then my father was wrong. The first time Elektra has asserted her own authority. Th foreman is surprised, angry. But he doesn't question her. She moves toward the helicopter, says to Bond:
I have to check the upper lines.  Gabor will drive you back.
Always wanted to see the upper lines.
You don't take no for an answer, do you?
No. She shrugs, mischief in her eyes.
Alright then. Do you ski? Bond just smiles.
I've been known to.
The chopper swoops over SNOWY WASTES.  It reaches a mount peak, hovers.  The wind is strong, buffeting. Elektra and Bond are both now in ski suits, Bond wearing sleek black jacket.
Can't land.  Wind's too strong!
Just hold her steady. (to Bond)
You wanted to see it. She steps into her skis, opens the door.  Wind rushes in.
Without a moment's hesitation, Elektra leaps out of the chopper and falls fifteen feet, landing on the move.
Unbelieving, Bond quickly dons skis and leaps after her.
Below him on the mountain, she is already a way ahead.  H skiing is fearless.  Bond likes a challenge... They wind down the slope, competitive, testing one anothe enjoying it.
After an exhilarating run, she stops on the edge of a hug drop.  Bond joins her.  They look down at the snowy valle below.  A line of survey FLAGS visible through the middle

We're building from both ends.  This is where they'll meet.  Fifteen hundred miles from the Caspian to the Mediterranean. Bond and Elektra stand on the mountainside, feeling like only two people in the world, when they hear: THE DISTANT OF A PLANE.

They see FOUR OBJECTS falling out the back of the aircraf As the objects plummet silently toward the earth, they PO PARACHUTES, their fall slows and then, as Bond and Elektr watch in disbelief... GUNFIRE echoes out from the black shapes, now visible as PARASKIS, low-flying, sleek, deadly snow vehicles.
Bond turns to Elektra, he has to yell over the sound of t approaching machines.

Head for that gully, I'll lure them into the trees! He points her off to one side, where a shallow gully offe cover...she skis off to shelter and he skis OUT...INTO TH OPEN...where the paraskis trail after him... He streaks toward the trees as the vehicles gain on him, firing...

He makes it to the woods, finding cover in the trees, whipping in and out of sight as PARASKI #1 tries to follo sinking lower and lower until... HIS SKIDS catch on some over hanging branches...the Paras is CATAPULTED into a tree and EXPLODES...

Coming in to pick up the pursuit of Bond is Paraski #2, firing down at Bond, dropping bombs which explode just be him in the snow.  The other two paraskis LAND and eject t chutes, now RACING THROUGH THE WOODS on the ground. Bond looks behind him, sees them gaining...he zigzags thr the trees and suckers Paraski #3 to glance off one tree, another and wipe out behind. But the remaining predator on the ground, Paraski #4, is gaining on him...Bond bursts out of the trees and finds himself heading toward... THE EDGE OF A PRECIPICE... He cranks himself right, narrowly avoiding a tumble over edge.  Paraski #4 isn't so lucky and SAILS OFF THE CLIFF hundred and fifty foot drop.
(smiling)

Should have stuck to snowboarding. But the smile is wiped off his face as...AN EMERGENCY PARACHUTE deploys from the back... The Paraski does a climbing turn and heads straight back him... Bond skis for his life, away from Paraski #4 when PARASKI appears in front of him...guns blazing... One ahead and one behind, Bond turns back...he has nowher go but...

He sails through the air and lands on the Paraski #4, slashing the parachute with his ski pole before bouncing and doing an amazing tumbling hundred foot fall to the sn where he lands on his skis... Paraski four, the chute tangling in the rotors of its propeller, struggles to maintain control, his vehicle inexorably hurtling toward PARASKI #2: both of them having set their course for Bond they are now on a collision course with EACH OTHER...

Bond meets up with Elektra as above them... The two Paraskis collide, crashing into the snowy hill ab and tumbling down, end over end. Bond and Elektra huddle together as shards and debris rai down on them. Then...silence.  An eerie silence.

Are they gone? All of them? Bond nods, ripping from his pole a PIECE OF THE PARACHUTE slashed and wiping his face with it...he looks at the pie of fabric in his hand.  He sees: CYRILLIC LETTERS...undecipherable to us...but there is a on his face, a look of recognition as... AN EARTH RATTLING RUMBLE grows above them. Bond stuffs the parachute fragment in his ski-suit as he turns... The exploding Paraskis have triggered AN AVALANCHE on the slope above.
They try to outrun it -- riding the sliding hill -- but t haven't a hope... the rest of the snow is catching them, they're going to get swallowed.
The ground shudders, the THUNDER CLOSING...  Their ankles soon covered, Elektra falls.  Bond stops, pulls her up. They're about to die.  He pulls her to him.

Hold on to me. She's confused and frightened but does as she's told. They hold one another tight as -- here it comes -- the wh fury hurtles over them, burying them...  At the last mome just as their heads vanish from view... CLOSE ON BOND PULLING THE Q GADGET ON THE JACKET. The AIRBAG slams open.  The snow covers it and them.  Mor and more snow slides over...

Darkness.  The RUMBLING CEASES... Light emanates from Bond's watch.  In the shadows he pull knife, punctures the air bag. It deflates, leaving them cocooned in an icy tomb.  Elektra looks around, staring, unbelieving.
Oh my God...we're buried alive...
We're alright. But her breath is coming in short, irregular bursts.
I can't stay here.
You're not going to. Bond takes a knife from a sheath around his ankle.  Flick open the small blade.  He starts to cut a hole in the sno above their heads. She stops him.
No!  It will cave in!
It's the only way out... The snow CREAKS eerily, she gasps, terror mounting.
I can't breathe, I can't breathe... Bond grabs her, holds her tight.  She resists, bucks.
Elektra, look at me, look in my eyes! (she does)
You're alright. Everything will be alright.  Trust me. Finally, arrested by the strength in his eyes, she calms.
A beautiful expanse of smooth virgin snow.  All is quiet.

Bond's fist PUNCHES through the white.  He pulls the snow away, climbs out.  Leans in, lifts Elektra out. Bond and Elektra stand, lone figures in the perfect white They hear a sound...HELICOPTER ROTORS.  Rescue on its way
An establishing shot of Bond's BMW parked outside the orn villa on the shore of the golden Caspian.

Palatial.  Hallway dominated by a LARGE PAINTING of a bea man in traditional Turkish garb, sitting proudly on a hor Davidov, Gabor, waiting, pacing. Bond is sits in a chair, ON EDGE, writing something over over on a small pad of paper...THE CYRILLIC LETTERS on th parachute fragment. A DOCTOR comes down the grand staircase. The men stand.
She's fine. Contusions. A slight strain to her ankle, but otherwise, fine. (to Bond)
She wants to see you.

Bond enters. Elektra is standing by the window watching t golden ball of the sun sink into the sea. She wears nothi but a silk embroidered robe; the sun shows through it, outlining her naked body in soft, shadowy curves.
Are you alright? He nods.  He is wound tight, she senses it.
I can't stay.
I know. A moment.
I need to ask you something.  And I need you to tell me the truth. He waits.
Who is it? Who is trying to kill me? Bond looks at her; vulnerable, fragile, trying to be stro He cannot tell her the truth.
I don't know. But I will find him. She stares at him, sensing he is withholding something. S turns back to the window. He approaches behind her.
After the kidnapping...I was afraid to go outside, to be alone, to be in a crowd, to do anything at all, until I realized... (pause)
There's no point in living if you can't...feel alive. She looks out at the fading sun.
I can't huddle in the shadows. I can't let fear run my life.  I won't. She turns to him.
The way I acted, in the snow...you must think I'm a coward.

I think you're one of the bravest people I've ever met. She looks up at him, into his eyes; they are so close. Al she has to do is tilt her mouth upward...she kisses him. hands come up across her back, pressing her toward him, h body melting into his, and then... He pulls back. Has to physically step away from her.
What is it?
...you should rest. That was exactly the wrong thing to say. He sees the rebellion flair in her eyes.
James...
I have to go.
Then take me with you.
No. You'll be safe here.
I don't want to be safe!
I have to go to work. He starts toward the door.
Now who's the coward? He stops, his back up...then heads out the door.
He passes Gabor, standing faithfully outside.
Elegant, mysterious.  A modern day Casablanca.
Bond in evening dress in the sumptuous casino. He takes o the Q glasses, slips them on, surveys the room --

He can see all the WEAPONS carried by the players.  All s of pistol, even the odd grenade.  The obvious side-effect this view -- he can see through clothes. His eyes alight on two girls walking away from him.  One them turns to look back, unaware that she is on display. returns Bond's smile.  Her friend turns to look.  Bond's smile grows:  she has a small pistol concealed over one breast.
He looks over the lenses -- and spies someone on the frin His old adversary, ex-KGB, VALENTIN ZUKOVSKY, talking to suspicious types. Zukovsky looks across. Bond walks towar him.
Valentin Zukovsky.
BondJamesBond. What brings you here?
You, of course. I need some information.
Bond, I'm a civilian. This is my place. Used to be the royal family's, now it's mine. I run my little business, I stay out of trouble...
(looking about)
Mafia warlords, Diplomats and spies, consortiums from every country in the world.  A nice little rat's nest.
(offering hors d'ouevres)
Have some of the rat's nest caviar.  From my own fishery.  They buy my caviar, drink my champagne, lose to my House. He turns to a suspicious-looking Heavy.
Let me introduce you to a former colleague of mine at the KGB. Dmitri Palov, you may know him as...the Boa. The Boa is completely bald, muscular; huge, deadly hands.
The great 007. For years I have dreamed of closing my hands around your neck.
Boa. Have you had any therapy since Perestroika?
Why am I suddenly worried I'm not carrying enough insurance? The Boa leaves, glaring all the while.
See?  You're upsetting my customers. What do you want?
How does a terrorist like Renard supply his men with state-of-the-art Russian Army weapons?
What?  This is not possible. Bond takes from his pocket the fragment of the PARACHUTE. Zukovsky examines the letters.
If I remember my Cyrillic that says 101st airborne division.
Where did you get this?
Off a high-powered Paraski that was trying to kill me. Zukovsky shakes his head. Sighs.

The Russian Army, they spend millions on flying skis, but they cannot afford to pay the soldiers. The men, they do what they have to do to feed their families. In this country, for the right price and a pack of cigarettes, you can get anything you want. He notices Bond watching THE HOSTESS BAR...a dark alcove the casino, where slinky HOOKERS flatter the guests.
That too. Everyone does what they can to survive.
How high up does this...arms dealing go?
Bond. If someone wants you dead, it is Renard. Our government has nothing to gain by killing you.
But you would have something to gain by killing Robert King. And stopping his pipeline. This hits Zukovsky. He closes down. A chill between them.

Poor Bond. The cold war is over.  What have you got left? Economic espionage. Murder in the boardroom.  So dull. Bond's eyes catch something, someone entering the casino. HIS POV:  ELEKTRA...more vibrant than we have ever seen h living up to her name. She is impossibly glamorous in a sparkling dress that fits like second skin.  Her hair is and tumbling, her eyes are fiery and wild.

Oh, you'd be surprised. Bond starts toward her, but she tosses her head, defiant, turns away, making her way to the Roulette tables. Bond follows her across the casino. They are like two cat moving through this neon jungle, their energy dangerous a sexy, all eyes on them. He takes note as she passes...MIN $100, then $500, $1000... She finally stops at the 'No limit' table.  Crowded with nastiest and richest of the high rollers, Armenians, Turk South Americans, a computer nerd American and a Russian industrialist's wife, heavy with jewelry and drink. ZUKOVSKY is suddenly there, pulling out a seat for her in center.
We've kept your father's chair free.
And his account?
You have a credit line of a million and a half. He gestures to the Dealer, who pushes ten towering stacks CHIPS toward her. A WAITRESS is right there to take her order.
Vodka martini.
Two. Shaken not stirred. He leans in, smiling his charming smile as he says:
What the hell are you doing here?
(smiling right back)
Someone wants to kill me, I'd rather die looking him straight in the eye. (lightly)
What are you doing here?  Looking for a woman a little more your type? How about that one? She points to a SHOW GIRL in a feather headdress and past
If this little show is for my benefit, I'll take you home right now.

You had your chance, James. Now I'm looking for a bigger thrill. She pushes half her chips back onto the table, letting th stand on her bet.  The whole table exhales. Then, it star bets are placed, gamblers energized by her arrival. Bond scans the room, vigilant, nervous... HIS P.O.V.  He zeroes in on Davidov, sidling off, away fr the table, trying to look nonchalant, his eyes shifting t way and that...he looks suspicious as hell. Bond watches, his blood running, and then... Davidov slips into the HOSTESS BAR.  A HOOKER is soon wrapping herself around him. After a few words, she leads off toward the back. Bond returns to the game, shaking his head.  He watches a THE DEALER DEALS FROM THE SHOE.

A small room.  Lit by sconces that sport LIVE FLAMES.  Ta luxurious, a refracted Eastern reflection on an old west whore house. Davidov undresses in the little bathroom alcove.  He face small ornate mirror over the sink, in which he can see TH HOOKER behind him, on the bed.
You want to be...on top, or not on top?
On top. She slowly pulls a pair of SILK ROPES out from her bra an DANGLES THEM.

Tied up, or not tied up? Davidov smiles, struggling with his belt.  He looks down, gets it, looks up...his heart stops...it is not the hooke the mirror but... RENARD'S FRIGHTENING FACE. Davidov spins. HIS P.O.V.  Renard's henchman stands by the door, an automatic rifle cocked at Davidov.
Dead, or not dead?
Elektra with black king showing. A seven beneath.
I understand it's normally good practice to get the feel of the cards before going off the deep end.
Really? And with a smile she scratches her cards on the table for hit.  The Dealer gives her an eight.  She reveals her car
Bust. He rakes in her chips. But Elektra is undeterred.  She pu another pile forward as the next deal commences.
I like the deep end, James.

The HENCHMAN holds Davidov against the wall with his huge fist around his neck.  Near his head, the live flame of a SCONCE hisses, burning blue and yellow, drawing their fue from the glass basin of hot oil attached beneath it. The HOOKER, obviously one of Renard's gang, has finished donning her khaki pants and combat boots and straps a gun onto her shoulder. Renard looks distastefully at the room.
Is this how you spend the money I pay you? And with the rest you hire fools who shoot like blind men?
(croaks out)
Bond...
Should be dead as well. Your failure today is astonishing.  It is a disgrace. He approaches close to him, stopping at the flaming SCONC near his head.
Do you know why the color is blue at the wick? Davidov starts to sweat.
Because that is where the flame is the hottest. Renard touches the glass well of oil.

The temperature is close to five hundred degrees. Renard uses his knife and POPS the seal from the lamp, removing the well of oil...a DROP of the hot oil FALLS ON HAND and SINGES IT BLACK in an instant... Renard does not even flinch.  Davidov starts talking, try to placate...
The plane...it's all been arranged...
Then you are completely unnecessary... Renard raises the container of oil over Davidov's head:

I have the documents, the landing authorizations, the security passes... Renard stops, the oil tilted, just ready to pour... His dead eye...has it drooped further since we last saw him?...seems to glitter in the light...
Bond is suspicious. We are moving sooner, tonight.  We understand each other?

Yes...yes... Renard lets a TRICKLE OF OIL drop onto Davidov's head... HE SCREAMS as his hair smokes and singes... Renard makes a motion, the THUG releases Davidov, who fal to the floor, clutching his head.

Another deal. ZUKOVSKY and others watch, as Elektra stake even more.  People move closer for a view.  The Dealer sh a five. Elektra shows Bond her cards. Elektra is holding two eights. Dealer's up-card is a six.
Stand or split them. She smiles. He holds her gaze.
Surely you believe in living dangerously.
Not at that price. Time to surrender. They eye one another a long while -- sex firmly in the ai She smiles.  She moves ALL HER CHIPS forward. Bond catches a look between the Dealer and Zukovsky:
The House has no limit. General kerfuffle.  Bond looks back toward THE HOSTESS BAR...no sign of Davidov's return...
(to Dealer)

Hit me. The Dealer scoops a card from the shoe.  Tension.  Everyo holds their breath...as he turns over...  -- a six.  Bust The audience inhale as one AS THE DEALER TAKES ALL HER CH AWAY. Elektra stands.  She has dignity in defeat. She turns to Bond, holding out a hand.
Time to surrender.
Bond, Elektra, Gabor outside, Davidov soon joining them, trying to look like he hasn't been through hell.  Bond notices the burn on his head. Davidov touches it self- consciously.
A little accident.
A night of burning passion? Davidov scowls at him. Bond leads Elektra away...
Someone watches Bond and Elektra move toward his BMW.
What about Bond?
RENARD and his henchmen, watching. Renard seems mesmerize the sight of Bond's HAND on the small of Elektra's back, their easy sensuality as they both get into the car.
Sir?  Sir?
(seething)
I will take care of Mister Bond.

Bond and Elektra emerge from the BMW.  Behind them, Gabor Davidov get out of her car. Bond watches as Davidov slams door and marches off, angry, toward the SECURITY QUARTERS the side of the house. Bond and Elektra walk to the front door, anticipation thi in the air.  Gabor opens the door. Elektra sweeps through

Bond pauses just inside the open doorway. HIS P.O.V.  Two figures in the cavernous entrance hall, Elektra having a brief word with Gabor, before he turns a exits, leaving only... ELEKTRA AND BOND. She starts upstairs, Bond's eyes locked on her body, and then: SHE LOOKS BACK...just once.  But it says everything. She continues upward. Bond taps the front door closed with his foot.

Half-light.  They're entwined between the sheets.  This i something slow, languorous, not to be rushed.  We can't m out the mechanics, but they're beaded with sweat. Her fingers trace the contours of his torso.  Linger on h bruised collar-bone.
You knew when you first saw me.  You knew it would be like this.
Shush. Her hand dips in an ice bucket beside the bed.  She rubs slither of ice down her chest, shudders with pleasure.  I a move Bond hasn't seen before. Now she brings the ice to his shoulder.
Poor shoulder. Looks painful... She kisses his purple flesh.  Licks.
...needs constant attention... She slides her tongue back and fore along the groove abov the tendon.  And he pulls the ice from her hand:
Enough ice for one day. Tosses it across the room as passion takes over...

A puddle of water where the ice fell. Post-sex on the bed. He traces a hand down her naked back The sweat glistens off the curve of her spine.  She turns The light glints off her jewelled earlobe...he touches it
You never take this off? Elektra looks at him.

Why do men always want to undress the one part of a woman's body she doesn't want to reveal? She reaches to the large, diamond-encrusted earring and gently plucks it away. Pulls her lush hair back... The lower half of her ear is gone, reduced to a misshapen clump of scar tissue. It is the only mark on her perfect body. A physical reminder of her ordeal. It breaks his he
How did you survive?
I used my body on the guards.  It gave me control. I got to a gun and I took my chance. (beat)
I've never told anyone that. They are looking at each other, both suddenly feeling something dangerously close to real connection.  It is no what Bond expected.
Do you ever stop, James?  Do you ever think about...another kind of life? He holds her gaze for a long time before he looks away.
I can't afford to. She frowns, slightly.  Settles into his chest.
Don't worry. I know who you are. He holds her, eyes full of conflict, staring into the dar
The lights of a car pulling up at the security office by perimeter wall of the property.

Bond's car, several of Elektra's vehicles, all parked aro the security office.  They have been joined by: A WHITE ECONOMY CAR, a Russian make, with a familiar SEAL painted on the door...we've seen it before, the seal on t of the stolen report at the beginning...Miratom. Out of the driver's seat steps...DAVIDOV.  He carries a briefcase from the car to the front door of the security office. He looks around furtively before he disappears inside. The parking area is dark and silent and then: JAMES BOND sits up in the driver's seat of his BMW.

Bond sticks his key in the ignition and activates the car various systems. HIS P.O.V.  Davidov is a shadow in the office window. Bond flicks a switch.  A NEEDLE-THIN BEAM is directed fro the BMW to the window of the office.  He can HEAR a synth of Davidov's voice...

I'm running late...no, no, I'll make it...how will they know I'm your man?...romashka...romashka...alright. Bond hears the click of a phone hanging up.  He flicks another switch in his car, an infra-red tracking system activates in his WINDSCREEN... He can now see Davidov perfectly as he comes out of the security quarters, carrying a briefcase and a large DUFFL BAG which he carries to the car and loads into the TRUNK. He goes back inside. BOND gets out of the BMW.  He moves stealthily to the Rus vehicle and, using the laser beam on his watch, opens the lock on the trunk.  It pops open. Bond sees the briefcase, and the dufflebag, and...SOMETHI ELSE...something beneath them...he moves the objects asid A MAN is folded into the back of the trunk, his head slum forward, dark hair on the back of his head slightly wet ...blood? Bond tips the head back, revealing GLASSY DEAD EYES. Bond leans in and plucks a BADGE from his white shirt poc It has a photo of the dead man and reads, in English and Cyrillic: LEONID TASHKA - FIELD INSPECTOR.  On the corner the badge...THE RUSSIAN SEAL...Miratom. The one from the report.  Bond touches it with his thumb, recognizing it.
Davidov is coming out... Bond LOWERS THE TRUNK DOOR and crouches behind the car.

Davidov pauses to lock the door. He walks toward the Russ car...he is actually WHISTLING a happy tune and then... HE STOPS. He has heard something. He draws his gun. He wa AROUND the entire car.  When he gets to the rear... THE TRUNK IS CLOSED.  Bond is not there.  No evidence he was. Davidov gets in the driver's seat and starts the car.
The Russian car drives onto the grounds of a small, deser AIRPORT consisting of one outbuilding and a crudely clear airstrip.
Davidov pulls off the road and parks his car in a wooded area.

Davidov's feet crunch in the dirt as he walks to the back opens the trunk. He removes the briefcase.  Then the duffle bag.  He looks down at the dead body,  head slumped forward, as before.. something is different, the clothes not quite right and t THE DEAD BODY MOVES, the head turns, Davidov gasps... It IS JAMES BOND.

Problem, comrade? Davidov pulls his HAND GUN from inside his coat, but Bond quicker.  With a silenced pistol he shoots Davidov in the head. One little red hole forms in his forehead as his ey go wide and he crumbles, dead. Bond climbs out of the trunk.  Crouches to examine Davido

Old habits die hard. He straightens.  Picks up the briefcase.  It is locked. searches Davidov and finds a set of keys in his pocket. opens the lock. INSIDE THE BRIEFCASE:  FOUR STACKS OF MONEY.  Documents headed with the official crest of Miratom.  A new securit tag, it looks just like the dead guy's, but has Davidov's name and picture...some hologrammed (blank) security tags and a polaroid-type camera. He picks up a blank security tag and inserts it in the camera.  Points at himself, takes a shot.  Punches in 'Davidov' on the KEYPAD.  Out comes a brand new pass. Bond goes to look in the dufflebag but... A PLANE is approaching...HE LOOKS UP. HIS P.O.V.  A Russian military jet appears over the trees flying low, its red landing lights blinking.

A door opens on the sinister-looking plane.  A hydraulic unit folds out of it.  A BIG SOLDIER with a machine gun w in the doorway. BOND, standing at the edge of the runway, clips on his ba and picks up the briefcase.  He has NO IDEA what he's wal into.

Here goes nothing. He hoists the dufflebag over his shoulder and walks out t the plane.  He starts up the steps: THE SOLDIER POINTS HIS GUN DOWN AT HIM. Says something to IN RUSSIAN. Bond pauses.  And then, thinking, says:
Romashka. The soldier looks at him, then lowers his weapon.

Four soldiers. The first guy and a moustachioed PILOT and young men, a nasty-looking private, cadaverously thin, an big, thick-necked tough. They all look at Bond, expectantly, waiting for him to sa do...what? He decides to take the lead. He opens the briefcase and hands over the STACKS OF MONEY. The Pilot passes it out. But that isn't the end. They sti stare at him.  The Pilot says something IN RUSSIAN that sounds like..."where's the rest?" Bond swallows.  Thinks, without showing it.  He decides t OPEN THE DUFFLE BAG.  He looks inside. Pauses, then reach in and takes out...A BOX OF NIKE SHOES. The thin soldier smiles. That's the ticket. Bond hands ou shoes to the rest of the guys.
A red dawn.  Dominating the landscape, a valley of weirdl shaped rocks. To one side, an airstrip.  The plane approaching.

The three soldiers wear their new shoes and smoke and cha amongst themselves. Bond sits in the rear of the plane, which is dominated by heavily buffered receptacles, clearly awaiting some deadl cargo. There is Russian writing everywhere, and one symbo clearly recognizes:  DANGER - RADIOACTIVE. Bond looks out of the window.  Beneath a huge MESA, a hud of low buildings. They come to a stop near the end of the runway.  A SMALL is driving out to them. One of the soldiers throws something to Bond. An ORANGE JUMPSUIT that says Miratom on the breast.  He catches it.
(subtitles)
You have fifteen minutes.
Bond, in the orange overalls and wearing his ID tag, is driving with a Russian soldier through the weird rock val
A cloud of dust from a detonation rises up on the other s of the hill.

They turn the corner and see trucks marked IDA, several Kazakhstan army personal carriers, soldiers dotted around IDA (International Decommissioning Agency) scientists and personnel quietly going about their business.  A vast protective 'bubble' is inflated at the front of the build

The sound of breathing LOUD, we're looking from inside th visor of a protective suit.  It's hard to tell what's goi on, but our hands are removing a sphere of cobalt blue plutonium from inside a corroding WARHEAD...
An officer eyes Bond's pass.
(subtitles)
You are late. The transport documents? Bond shows him the case.  Akakievich examines the documen
(subtitles)

They are waiting for you below.  It should be ready. Check with the IDA physicist. He points toward the "bubble." Inside the transparent bubble, a protective-suited FIGURE finishes placing a blue PLUTONIUM CORE into a box. As Bond and the Colonel walks toward the bubble, the FIGU steps out, still enveloped in the white protective suit. Moving fast, off comes the helmet to reveal a BEAUTIFUL AMERICAN GIRL.  CHRISTMAS JONES is mid-twenties, shortish hair, hot right now.  In one movement she unzips and step out of the suit, revealing a khaki sports bra, cut-off shorts, heavy duty boots.  A nasty-looking hunting knife strapped around her hips.  She has a deep tan and an incredible figure. She grabs a bottle of water, guzzles. Bond tosses an arched brow to Akakievich, who nods bitter also unable to take his eyes off her.  He spits on the fl and speaks in ENGLISH, so Christmas can hear.

Not interested in men. Take my word for it. Akakievich isn't exactly what you'd call a looker.  Bond offers a disappointed tut as Akakievich walks away. Christmas approaches.  He notices her IDA tag -- and an incongruous PEACE TATTOO just above her hip. She's checki him out as well.
You new?
(Russian accent)
Yes. Viktor Davidov, Miss...?
Doctor. Jones. Christmas Jones. No jokes, I've heard them all.
Don't know any doctor jokes. She is wary.  It's been a long time since a man this attractive stepped onto her beat. They walk toward the building.
What happened to Len Tashka?
Couldn't make it. Splitting headache.

The soldiers may give you a hard time. Whatever. If we weren't around, they'd have their whole nuclear arsenal lying by the roadsides, rotting in the sun. Bond looks at the ominous radiation WARNING SIGNS.
Will I need protection? She squints at him, taken aback.
There's no radiation danger down there. Bond turns to go, knowing he misstepped.  Christmas then speaks to him, asking a question, IN RUSSIAN.
(subtitles)
Where is this stockpile going? Bond turns, answers IN PERFECT RUSSIAN.
(subtitles)
To the nuclear facility at Penza 19. She nods. Watches him disappear into the building.
Bond descends, going down deep.
The elevator creaks to a halt.  He slides the elevator do OPEN revealing... TWO SOLDIERS waiting for the elevator. Bond shows them hi ID.
(subtitles)

See the corporal, at the end of the chamber. The soldiers get into the elevator and disappear, leaving Bond completely ALONE. Dead silence in the shadows.  Bond's in his element, that alert glint in his eye as he takes in his surroundings. HIS P.O.V.  A long, dark corridor...leading off to a more open circle in the distance, lights and an ominous hummin there. Bond starts down the passageway.

Ahead of Bond, like a deadly spider at the centre of a we NUCLEAR BOMB suspended over a pit. Blast openings range around to channel its fury to measur equipment. Bond is alone with the bomb. An eerie moment. Then, he co to notice a figure, across the expanse of the pit, on the opposite side of the catwalk, a man, with his back to him Russian Army fatigues.
Corporal? The man turns... IT IS RENARD. He smiles.
I see my friend Davidov ran into some difficulty.
Indeed. Renard starts toward him.  Bond draws his gun.
Don't come any closer.
You can't kill me. I'm already dead. He and Bond face off, the malevolent bomb between them, a ROBOT DEVICE beginning to lower it into the pit.

Go ahead.  Shoot.  My men will still steal the bomb, and the shot will bring them directly to you. Renard gestures into the pit. BOND'S P.O.V.  TWO OF RENARD'S MEN in the pit, unaware of what is happening above, working directly with the bomb. of them is using a manual...IT IS JUST LIKE THE STOLEN REPORT, the Miratom seal in the corner. Bond aims his gun at Renard's head.
Who's paying you to destroy the pipeline? Renard resumes walking, around the catwalk at the edge of pit, toward Bond, slowly, surely, totally fearless.

To die by a man who can't even grasp what he's caught up in... Bond, out of the corner of his eye, sees Renard's man rem a SMALL DEVICE from inside the bomb.  It is the size and shape of a credit card, black, with shiny transistors on it...the man slips it into his pocket.
Revenge isn't so hard to fathom. What's clever is getting someone else to pay for it.
Not many people in this world have that kind of fortune. Bond cocks the pistol.
Who is it?
You think I fear death? I welcome it. I get on my knees and pray for it. You, on the other hand, you have something to live for, no? (closer now)

She's beautiful isn't she? You should have seen her before. Flawless, and still so innocent, not such a whore in bed... Bond's eyes flare in fury.  He shoves Renard into the wal and presses the gun to his temple.
You will never touch her. You will never get near her.
Have you forgotten who saved your life in Geneva?
Consider me ungrateful.
It's I who should thank you -- for taking that money back to MI-6.  So distressing for M.  An explosion inside her lair.
She'll get over it.

You even brought the plane for us.  We really couldn't have done it without you. Bond strikes him across the temple with his pistol.  Rena drops to his knees.  He touches his temple, looks at the blood curiously, feeling no pain.
A man tires of being executed. As Bond screws a silencer onto the muzzle of his gun:

But then again...There is no point in living if you can't...feel alive. Bond knows that, he's heard it somewhere before...IT FREE HIM, just a beat, but it is enough... SUDDENLY, the noise of footsteps -- CHRISTMAS JONES, with COLONEL AKAKIEVICH and two armed soldiers. We're with them as they turn the corner of the passageway see Bond with silenced pistol aimed at the kneeling Renar classic execution stance:
(to Bond)
Drop your gun.
Keep away, Colonel. The soldiers' guns are trained on Bond.
He is an impostor. (clutching a printout)
There's no Davidov at Miratom.

Here's your imposter. He's paid off the men on the plane outside.  They're not taking the bomb to any Russian facility, they're flying it wherever he tells them. Christmas is listening, but Akakievich cocks his rifle.
(to Bond)
I said drop it. And he means business.  Bond delays ... but has no choice He pulls the clip from his gun, tosses it down.
(to Christmas)
Well done -- he would have killed us all. I suppose you (to Akakievich)

were you the one who allowed him down? Colonel Akakievich looks suitably stung.  But Renard is looking past him now, as with a quiet WHIRR, the BOMB rai into view on a trolley.  Renard's team is ready to move.
(to Akakievich)
Take him away, I don't want him around as we move the bomb. (whispered, to Bond)

You had me.  I knew you couldn't shoulder the responsibility... And Renard jams his hand onto Bond's shoulder, squeezing collar-bone hard...  Pain jolts through Bond, he drops to knees in agony. He shoves Bond down.  Bond's hand goes to shoulder, his mind now racing -- how did he know to hurt there? Renard's men start to maneuver the bomb toward the curvin passageway.  It's all too much for Colonel Akakievich:

No -- the bomb does not go anywhere until I am satisfied.  All of you to the surface, now... Renard stops and turns.  Bond sees him nod to two of his one quietly slopes off down the tunnel.  The other innoce opens a container...
Camera shows the INSIDE of the container's lid; the man releases a false lining to reveal several MACHINE GUNS...
(urgent now)

Very well, Colonel. We will all go up. One of Colonel Akakievich's men gestures with his gun tha Bond should get up.  Knowing it's now or never, Bond PUSH him away, yanks a PISTOL from his holster, GRABS Christma LEAPS down into the bomb PIT just as RENARD'S MEN open fire...  Akakievich dies straight away. do two of his men.  The gunfire RICOCHETS around the cham and ceases. Renard hangs back.  His radio crackles a message:
(nods, into radio)
Shut them.

head_text.subj: THE GUY ON THE OTHER END OF THE RADIO

text: Right next to the ELEVATOR.  He turns a switch that activ two sets of red buttons and two sets of green. He punches one green button...
Heavy doors close all exits but that to the tunnel.
Bond and Christmas know they are being sealed in.
Melt-down doors.  If he gets them closed, they won't be opened again for forty- eight years. Bond peers over the edge -- sees Renard and his men worki the nuclear device into THE PASSAGEWAY.

If Bond doesn't get through now, they're trapped forever. points his wrist watch toward the cat walk above and pres a button...THE TINY GRAPPLING HOOK shoots out, Q's super filament wire that can hold up to 800 pounds is attached...Bond uses the rope to RAPPEL UP THE SIDES OF T PIT and into

Where he LEAPS ON TOP OF Renard's last man.  They fall THROUGH THE IRIS, it SHUTS behind them.  The man swings h machine gun at Bond -- it hits the wall next to him, brea apart.  Bond grabs a broken section and kills him with on strike. He pauses at his dead body and reaches into his jacket, retrieving...THE CARD-LIKE DEVICE.
Christmas looks around, desperate to help.  Using Bond's wire, she climbs up to the CLOSED IRIS DOOR.  She pries o a panel next to it and reveals complex WIRING...

Up ahead of Bond, the bomb disappears down the passageway can see it is attached to A PULLEY above, helping the men move quickly, Renard, pulling, the two men pushing Renard signals one of them to drop back to cut off Bond.. Machine-gun fire turns the wall next to Bond to dust -- B dives to a recess.  An overhead LIGHT SHATTERS.  His sect of the tunnel darkens.
Bond looks up at the broken LIGHT.  Takes careful aim at next one along.  BLAM.  It disintegrates.  Again...

The other guy answers with another spray of bullets.  Wat uneasily as Bond takes out light after light.  A funnel o darkness coming to swallow him -- concealing Bond's appro Nervous, he fires, muzzle flash and sparks illuminating t void.  To keep it lit, he keeps firing...

WITH BOND as the bullets cease with a loud CLICK...  What Bond was waiting for.  He moves.  The gunman frozen in th light, grappling to fit another clip -- BLAM!  He goes down.  Bond not wasting bullets.
Renard is loading the bomb it into the ELEVATOR. He flick switch on the panel by the elevator.  The IRIS starts clo on Bond...

Bond rushes for the door -- but he's shocked as the man h shot lunges.  Clings to him. Bond hits him away, he LEAPS for the cart blocking his wa and SHOVES IT INTO THE IRIS DOOR just as it almost closes Bond squeezes through...
Renard is getting in the ELEVATOR.  Sees Bond made it, fi Bond rolls into a corner.
We have our fireworks.  Now you can have yours. And he machine-guns some barrels.  Rocket fuel spills out He digs a finger into one of the holes, effortlessly rips metal so more fuel cascades out.
Christmas cuts some wires together and with a hum, her IR DOOR OPENS...
Bond fires at Renard, hitting his shin...

looking down at his shin, noticing the blood.  Inconvenie but not in pain.  He shuts the cage doors.  Pauses only t fire off half a clip at the SWITCH PANEL.  Shreds it. Bond leaps to his feet, racing forward, firing -- gets to elevator as Renard disappears upwards with a smile. He PO DOWN...underneath him... Bond looks down. HIS P.O.V.  BENEATH THE ELEVATOR...A makeshift explosive device...sticks of dynamite wrapped around a detonator, s to explode Eyes wide, Bond looks back to the doors -- then to the sw panel -- now just a chaos of sparking wires.
The pipe bomb ticking...
Bond is trapped.  He looks up... THE PULLEY HOOK HANGS DOWN... He jumps up, grabbing it, just as...

The bomb ignites the spilled oil, A FIREBALL shoots along scorching after Bond, who is SAILING THROUGH THE PASSAGE the force of the blast sending him hurling down the passageway ON THE PULLEY...heading straight for: A CLOSED IRIS DOOR which miraculously begins to OPEN as h SHOOTS THROUGH... Ahead, the next door is OPEN as well. He sees CHRISTMAS o the other side... HER P.O.V.  Bond hurtling toward her, ahead of a MASSIVE FIREBALL...

Close the door!  Close the door! But before she can, two of the FUEL BARRELS HURTLE throug the closing iris, clattering into the pit, starting a fir below. Flames licking up the sides of the pit toward them. Bond looks up, sees the ARM OF THE ROBOT LIFTER, stretchi upward toward an old SHAFT t the top of the ceiling... He and Christmas scramble up the robot arm, walk along th spider-like web that supported the bomb and find... AN OLD ELEVATOR...powered by a hydraulic system... They get in...hear the rumbling of the fire below...the o elevator moves slowly...the rumbling grows louder...
Shame you had to spot I wasn't the real thing.
So who are you?
Bond -- Bond FIRES HIS GUN at the hissing hydraulic pulleys and.. THE ELEVATOR shoots through the shaft at breakneck speed BELOW THEM...THE PIT EXPLODES...
Fire shoots up. Bond lunges to cover Christmas. As the sm clears:
(finishing)
James Bond.

Christmas and Bond climb out of the duct.  Through a clou dust he can see people running about, panicked.  There's some shooting -- fresh corpses litter the ground. Bond looks past them to a plane coming this way.  The pla It roars past, level with them.  He follows it with his e helpless as it gets smaller and smaller...
They won't get far. Every warhead has a locator card.  A Miratom device.  Emits a high-pitched signal on Russian emergency frequencies. We can track the bomb.
With this? Bond removes the locator card from his jacket and shows i her.  It flashes in the sun. Christmas shakes her head, disgusted.
Busy.  Analysts huddle over monitors showing satellite images, trying to track the plane.
Do we have the range of Renard's plane?
Anywhere in this circle.  Iran, Iraq, Pakistan, Syria, Afghanistan...
Marvellous. Moneypenny enters...
Elektra King is calling from Baku. M is surprised.
It's a video line.
Put her on the wide screen. The face of ELEKTRA materializes on a large WALL MONITOR.
I'm sorry. I would never call you except...Bond's disappeared. He...he left my villa, some time in the middle of the night and... M exchanges a look with Tanner.
My head of security has been found near a local airstrip, murdered... M leans on the console in front of her.
I'll send someone out.
Could...could you come? M looks up. ELEKTRA, on the monitor, looks about as lost as she ever
I just can't help thinking...I'm next. M stares at the girl's face, her whole sordid history wri there.  M turns away from the screen and says to Tanner..
Get me out there.
Elektra's villa against blue-black storm clouds, the Casp choppy, wind blowing.

Elektra works in her father's STUDY, illuminated by a hal light from a single desk lamp. Pictures of her grandfathe and father stare down at her from the walls. The wind BLO WINDOW open. She gets up, crosses the room, shutting the window.  She stands there, listening to the silence and then... SHE HEARS A THUD. A strange, unsettling thud. She listens, a long time, to the silence.
Gabor...? She goes to the door, opens it...it whines on its hinges. She steps into...

A big room lined with books. Three french doors lead out balcony.  She walks a few paces in... THE DOOR SHUTS BEHIND HER, she whirls... GABOR, propped up behind the door, stares, wide-eyed, bef he FALLS TO THE FLOOR. Elektra gasps, she turns again... A DARK FIGURE LOOMS, a shadow against the windows.  He mo forward, his face becoming visible...IT'S BOND.
James! She stares at him, shocked, hesitant.
You look surprised. She moves to Gabor, gets down to help him.  He stirs, he alive, but unconscious. Elektra looks up at Bond.
What's wrong with you?  Are you crazy?
A little. Does it matter? After all, what's the point of living if you can't feel alive?  Isn't that right, Elektra? Isn't that your motto?
What are you talking about?
Or did you steal it from your old friend Renard?
...what?
We had a run-in, he and I. He knew about us, he knew about my shoulder, he knew exactly where to hurt me... Elektra stands...she begins to tremble.
Are you saying...Renard is the man who's trying to kill me?
You can drop the act, it's over.
I don't know what you're talking about!
I think you do. He walks toward her, threatening...

At MI-6 we call it Stockholm Syndrome. It's common in kidnappings.  A young impressionable victim. Sheltered, sexually inexperienced. A powerful kidnapper skilled in torture, in manipulation. Something snaps in the victim's mind. The captive falls in love with her captor. At the word "love," Elektra explodes.  She SLAPS an unsuspecting Bond hard across the face.

How dare you!  How dare you! That animal!?  That monster!? He disgusts me! You disgust me!  So he knew where to hurt you, is that it? You had a sling on your arm at the funeral! I didn't have to sleep with you to find that out.
He used your exact words.

You knew.  You knew all the time, that he was out there, that he was coming for me, and you lied. You used me, you used me as bait. You made love to me -- what, to pass the time as you waited for him to strike? He has no answer.  He can't deny what she says. The phone rings, cuts through the tension.  Bond and Elek staring at one another.  She lets it ring...  Then picks Listens, looks to Bond.
He's struck again. (beat)
Five men are dead at the pipeline. He moves toward her.
I'm coming with you.
You do what you have to do, but I've called in M.  She's en route from London even now.
The MI-6 chopper lands.  We can see M through the window. Face set hard.

SCIENTIFIC, MILITARY and TURKISH POLICE VEHICLES parked around a medium-sized industrial plant. Bond accompanies M and Tanner toward a clutch of offices. All around, SOLDIERS, IDA personnel, POLICE scour the are
(to Bond)
Glad to see you've turned up. He is moving fast, talking fast -- a sense of urgency.
They hit about 90 minutes ago. There's a scientist here from the International Decommissioning Agency, Dr. Jones.  She has ten crews combing the area. They step out of the bright sunlight and into

FIVE BODY BAGS are being carried out by soldiers.  M surv the scene; in an unlit corridor CHRISTMAS JONES and sever men sweep the area with CLICKING Geiger counters. ELEKTRA is a distance away, listening to a Turkish police explain what's happening.  She nods acknowledgement to M. Tanner senses that Bond wants to talk to M alone:
I'll see how they're coming with the power... They watch him go.  M turns to Bond:
You had your hand on the bomb and you let Renard get away with it. He draws her away, to a small alcove.  Takes something ou his jacket...THE LOCATOR CARD.
