The report King bought. It's a manual. Renard's men used it to remove this radio tracking device from the warhead.
Then Robert was right about a Russian connection.
They're getting their weapons from the Russians, but where are they getting the money to buy the weapons?  I can't help thinking...the person close to King, the one who switched that pin...
The inside man?
Is maybe...the inside woman. NOW THE LIGHTS POWER UP, disrupt the intimacy and intensi of their exchange.  The room is lined with MONITORS and a huge SATELLITE MAP of the pipeline's meandering path.
A woman? But before he can speak, ELEKTRA calls out, gesturing to DIM LIGHT flashing on a console in front of her.
That's not right. A Technician comes over.  Tanner too, followed by Bond an
What is it?
It's an observation and repair rig. Travels along the pipe, checks for broken seals.  But it's not supposed to be there.
(thinks)
Stop it. The Technician flicks two switches.  The light continues flash.  Confused, he tries others.  No change.
I don't understand...
Where is the rig? Harried, the Technician activates the wall schematic of t pipeline.  A pulse of light travels along the line. And w it, a sense of horror descends...
The parcel's in the post.
It's heading for the oil terminal.
Where it can do the most damage.
My God. (to one of her men)
Have the terminal evacuated. The man gets on the phone...
(to Tech)
Speed?
Full on.  Seventy miles an hour. He punches buttons. Christmas has come, stands next to Bo
One hundred and six miles from the terminal.
(quick)
It'll reach the other end in seventy- eight minutes. (to Tech)
Any more of these rigs? The Technician checks his records, looks up, nods.
There's one parked in the passageway ahead of it. Decisive, Christmas heads for the door, turns to her team
I'll need some help... Her IDA colleagues look sheepish.  Bond moves to her.
Come on. For just a moment, Christmas looks wary:
Unless you'd like to see my ID first. She almost smiles. M nods to Tanner to follow them.  Bond doesn't look at Elektra.  But she watches him go...
The MI-6 helicopter swoops along the pipeline... Tanner is beside the pilot.  Bond and Christmas in the ba They look at one another, the danger ahead melting the fr between them.

Bond and Christmas climb through an access hatch down ont the electric RIG.  Its lights blaze fifty yards into the tunnel.  Then darkness. Christmas takes the driver's spot, Bond the rear, nearest the approaching BOMB.  Tanner leans in:
(sealing them in)
Good luck. Bonds nods, checks his watch.  Christmas looks nervously the pipe.
Be one along any minute. And she starts the machine off...

It quickly picks up speed, its lights flooding the seemin endless pipe before them. Christmas looks behind, apprehensive.  Waiting for the li of the explosive rig. It's tense.  They travel along, expectant...
When this is over we should bury the hatchet. Celebrate. A champagne dinner?
When this is over our bodies may be blown to smithereens.
Alright then, brunch. His lightness relaxes her, she appreciates it.
Elektra, M, and others. The room is crowded with concerne personnel.  M watches the two blips on the schematic gett closer together. One of her MEN approaches, a radio in hi ear.
Tanner reports Bond is headed for the rendezvous.
Excellent. Evacuate Miss King and the others.
You can evacuate my workers, but I'm not going anywhere. M looks at her, then nods, impressed by her courage.

Bond and Christmas waiting expectantly.  Tense silence. Finally, a WHOOSHING NOISE, GETTING LOUDER.  Lights appea behind, reflecting on a bend, then... here it comes, the tearing through the pipe. Bond looks over his shoulder at Christmas' speedometer...she's only at fifty...

Faster! Get our speed up! Christmas presses forward...Bond turns, his feet OUT towa the approaching rig...the lights getting closer... closer Bond's rig jolts as the other makes contact.  He cushions blow with his feet.  Both rigs moving together now, he CL ONTO THE BOMB RIG...Puts out a hand, helps Christmas acro The bomb sits there, daunting, deadly.
Tactical fission device.  Low yield. They look at one another, then set straight to work.

The room is quiet, tense.  M and her two men, Elektra, Ga the King TECHNICIAN and three armed security guards at th doors. They are the only ones left.  Going down with the ship...if it goes.  M and Elektra watch the two lights no together on the console.  A tense silence.  Everyone's ed Elektra perhaps a little more than the rest.  She exchang glance with Gabor.
CLOSE INSIDE THE BOMB:  the timer.  1:45 MINUTES. Bond's face betrays the difficulty of what they're attempting.  The digital clock ticks down... 1:30, 1:29..
The rigs speed through the tunnel. Nothing to see.  But WHOOSH!  As the rigs hurtle past...
The pipe suddenly dips.  They cling on as the machine buc like a rollercoaster.  Back on a straight... Her brow furrows.
The plutonium is missing.  They've taken the core!
Then it's no longer a bomb?
(back to work, urgent)
It's a bomb alright. We're still dead if the trigger charge goes off... Bond's mind races in the ghostly light of the tunnel. He stares at the timer:  0:44, 0:43...  Makes a decision.
Let it blow. Christmas shoots a look, astonished.
But we can stop it. Taking her arm...
Let it blow. She can't believe what he's saying. His eyes shoot to an INSPECTION HATCH the lights illuminate up ahead.
Trust me.  Leave it. He grabs her, wrenches her away from the bomb.

The rig zooms past the exit hatch -- Bond leaps off, taki her with him.  They tumble along the pipe.  Agile, Bond springs to his feet, pulls her up.  They run like hell fo the hatch, into the darkness...
The pipeline.  A long beat, then... KABOOM!!  A section of the pipe explodes, debris rocketin every direction. As the smoke clears we see a fifty yard section of pipe h been destroyed.

On the consoles, red concentric circles pulse outward fro the point of impact, emitting one, monotone BEEP.... The watchers are frozen, stunned, shocked. Gabor, a radio earpiece in his ear, reports information.
It wasn't nuclear...the bomb was a dud. The trigger charge blew out a fifty yard section of pipeline...
And Bond? An agonizing beat. The alarm beep sputters and dies.
Nothing. M and Elektra share a look.
Do you think he's dead? M can't answer.  She shakes her head.
We just have to wait. M shifts. The hi-tech room is eerily lit by the pulsing r lights on every screen, showing the explosion.
(to M)
I have a gift for you.  Something that belonged to my father. He would have wanted you to have it. M feels uneasy.
Perhaps this isn't the time...
Please. She hands M a small box.  M unties the ribbon.
He often spoke of how...compassionately you advised him on the best course of action during my kidnapping. M opens the box.  It is THE EYE OF THE GLENS...the heirlo pin, the original.
It's very valuable, you know. I just couldn't let it explode with the rest of him. M looks up, horrified, when:

head_text.subj: GABOR AND ANOTHER SECURITY MAN SHOOT M'S TWO GUARDS IN TH

text: HEAD...point blank, cold blood.  The men fall. M looks back at Elektra, a blood-curdling glare.
(to her men)
Take her to the chopper.
From on high we follow the snaking pipeline ... until it disappears in a VAST, SMOULDERING BOMB CRATER.  Beyond, t pipeline continues unperturbed. Two TINY FIGURES on the banks of the crater.
Bond and Christmas, very much alive.  She's angry.
What the hell were you doing?  You nearly killed us!
I did kill us. She thinks we're dead. And she thinks she got away with it.
What the hell are you talking about?
It's part of some plan. She dresses it up like a terrorist attack.  The explosion covers up the theft of the plutonium.
Who's she?
Elektra King.
Elektra King?  Are you insane?  This is her pipeline.
Makes her look even more innocent.
(skeptical)
What would she want with weapons grade plutonium?
I was hoping you could tell me. Christmas stares at him.  Wheels turning.
You steal an old bomb, small by today's standards, about the size of the one that destroyed Nagasaki, take the plutonium core out of it, intending to use it... (beat)
To make a bigger, better bomb. They're both chilled by the thought.
I have to get after that core.  This is my ass. She starts fiddling with the radio. Suddenly there's a CRACKLE.
Tanner to 007, do you read? Bond grabs the radio.
Loud and clear.  I have to speak to M.
She's gone.
What?
She's disappeared.  And two of our men have been killed. It impacts on Bond.  His eyes harden.
What is it?
She just upped the stakes. All her chips are on the table now.  And M's life is part of the bet. He looks out at the long stretch of pipeline, like a dead snake with the world for its bed.
I know I promised you champagne, but would you settle for caviar?

A boat puts in at an ancient tower in the middle of a vas body of water (in fact, the Bosphorus). Renard disembarks with several of his retinue, heavily la with bags and cases.  They enter the tower...

A fantastic space:  stained glass windows cast myriad patterns over elaborate tile and marble surfaces.  Pillar iron lattices, velvet drapes and flowers embroider the hu room. As they enter, Elektra swoops across the floor and into Renard's arms.  He holds her.  She pushes him away.
You're hurting me. He senses something different between them.  She tries to hide it.
Brought me something? He smiles, grabs a case off one of his men, opens it up, pulls out a sphere of cobalt blue metal. She looks at it with wary fascination.
Go on.  It's safe.  Touch your destiny. She traces a finger along the metal.  A flicker of wonder
Warm.
(pointed)
Is it? She's sensitive to his buried frustration:
I've brought something for you as well.

Elektra opens a heavy door, she and Renard past through t A SMALL ROOM...a window set in the stone on one side.  Th other side is divided off by a WALL OF BARS, creating a c which now contains: M The cell is bare, except for a camp bed in the corner. M betrays no fear.  A quiet defiance burns in her.
Just as I promised. Renard steps forward.  Bars separate him from M.
My executioner.
Over-praise, I'm afraid.  But my people will finish the job.
Your people? Your people will leave you here to rot just like you left me. You and my father. He didn't think my life was worth the chump change he spent on a day at the stock market.
Your father...
Is nothing.  His kingdom he stole from my mother. The kingdom I will rightly take back. Elektra leaves.  Renard is left alone with M.
She's insane.  Is that what you did to her?
No. I'm afraid it is what you did. He crosses close to the bars.

When I took her she was...promise itself. So clever, so vibrant, so...full of life force. And you left her there, at the mercy of a man like me. You ruined her. For what?  To get to me? She is worth fifty of me.
For once, I agree with you. He shakes his head, amused by her pluck.
So she used all that brilliance to get revenge on her father, on me.
No. I wanted you. I wanted you for myself. He takes something out of his pocket.  A small TRAVEL CLO He sets it.

Since you sent your man to kill me, I have been watching time tick slowly away, marching inevitably toward my own death. Watch these hands, M. At noon tomorrow, your time is up. And I guarantee you...I will not miss.  You will die. Along with everyone in this city and the future of the West. He places the clock on a tall stool, just out of reach through her bars.  He leaves.  We hold on the clock: Eight p.m.

Valentin Zukovsky in the back of his chauffeured Rolls Royce...  We PULL BACK, to take in an amazing sight:  the is on a network of raised walkways and platforms that ext as far as the eye can see.  A decaying legacy of the Sovi years.
Zukovsky limps purposefully away from his Rolls along a walkway leading to a Beluga fishery built over the water.

Nailed on the battered old door, the lid of a caviar jar, label illustrated with a LINE DRAWING OF ZUKOVSKY. Zukovs opens the door and finds himself... Staring straight down Bond's pistol.  Bond and Christmas silhouetted by the gold dusk light.  At their feet lies o of Zukovsky's workers.
What are doing, Bond?  Trying to impress this innocent thing?
She's no innocent.  This is my nuclear consultant.
Ah, I see.  A purely...plutonic relationship. Hands held clear of his body, Zukovsky enters, his evenin dress decidedly out of place here.
Really Bond, couldn't you find a nice Russian scientist with hair growing out of his ears?
What's your business with Elektra King?
I thought you were the one in her business.
She dropped a million and half dollars to the House -- your House. And you didn't even bat an eyelid.  She was paying you off.  What for?
As ever you are the spy who has to see a plot wherever he looks. Bond SLAMS Zukovsky hard against a vat of caviar.  Wood splits, roe spills onto the floor.  Zukovsky is appalled.
That is 5,000 dollars of Beluga ruined!
You are out of your league.  She's working with Renard. Christmas moves in, intense but firm:
They've stolen a nuclear device. A subtle change in Zukovsky's countenance.
Tell us what you know, Zukovsky.  Tell us, before its too late. But it may be already: The SOUND OF A HELICOPTER.  Zukovsky frowns, the SOUND
Bond is the first to move as --
-- wood suddenly splinters everywhere -- the wall and roo tear open behind them - GIANT VERTICALLY-SUSPENDED SAWS R THROUGH, just missing them.
The blades churn through the corrugated roof, spraying CA everywhere.
Bond BURSTS OUT OF THE BUILDING...Zukovsky and his guards even the chauffeur are firing at the chopper...

Bond makes for his BMW, running down a flight of steps, o a lower walkway when...THE SECTION AHEAD OF HIM EXPLODES...the second chopper above hitting its mark with thrown grenade.  Bond is trapped by the fire and smoke, t only way out is ALONG THE PIPELINES...he runs along a nar section of pipe and then JUMPS DOWN to another walkway. PIPES are now above him...the chopper's relentless saws C THROUGH THE PIPE...GAS JETS OUT...Bond HURLS HIMSELF up a stairway.
Zukovsky and Christmas watch in horror as Chopper One bla away more roof above them.

Bond takes something out of his pocket, a remote control device...he presses some buttons...HIS CAR COMES TO LIFE...lights on, it drives toward him. He rushes to meet it. Chopper Two follows behind Bond, slicing up the walkway just behind him.  Bond gets to the and JUMPS IN as the chopper veers away.

Bond activates his missile device as he watches Chopper T pass behind the factory.  Suddenly there's a huge roar be him as the blades from Chopper One RIP THROUGH THE ROOF, SLICING HIS CAR IN HALF. But Bond is undeterred.  He sets off the missile toward t disappearing Chopper One.
A DIRECT HIT. Chopper One explodes and falls onto the wal setting the scene ablaze.

Zukovsky and Christmas see the explosion, then see Choppe Two dropped FOUR ARMED MEN onto a nearby walkway.  The me make their way toward the factory, firing at the guards. Zukovsky and Christmas are forced inside.

Who sees the danger to the others and runs off along the walkways back to the factory.  The Chopper follows him, shooting. Bond outruns it, until, ahead of him A GRENADE EXPLODES, destroying the walkway and hurling Bond into the water.
The gunfight continues as the armed men take out Zukovsky guards. Then, two of the assailants follow ZUKOVSKY and CHRISTMAS into...

The chauffeur is shot and killed.  The gunmen then turn t attention to Zukovsky and Christmas, when suddenly BOND APPEARS through a trap door in the floor boards. Bond shoots one of the gunmen, then fires on the other... Zukovsky grabs Christmas and they make their escape  Bond sees a third gunman firing from the basement and takes hi out.

Zukovsky and Christmas make a dash for Zukovsky's Rolls. They dive in...Zukovsky rams the car into reverse...behin him, A CHOPPER SLICES the walkway to smithereens...Zukovs can't stop it as the car leaps backward and into THE WATE BELOW....
Bond finishes off the remaining two armed men in a furiou gunfight and exits.

Bond sees Zukovsky and Christmas swimming to safety.  The chopper bears down on him.  He leaps back to what's left the building, picks up a flare gun.  He jumps down to a walkway at water level and cranks open a rusted GAS JET.. then waits for the Chopper to line up over it as it approaches Bond for the kill.... Bond fires the flare gun...
The Chopper tries to pull away, but it's too late.  The flames engulf it, igniting a fireball.
Zukovsky pulls himself back onto a walkway and heads for factory, but speeding at him are to FREE-FLYING SAW BLADE from the chopper that has just exploded! OMITTED 231S to 231Z

Zukovsky dives away -- into a CAVIAR PIT.  The saws embed the cabin behind him. The caviar pit is like sinking sand, deep -- he's going under.  Flounders, trying to cling to a crate blown in th by the explosion.  Then he looks in horror:
Bond appearing at the edge of the caviar pit, dragging himself up, soaking wet.  He's holding another harpoon gu Points it directly at Zukovsky.  This time he really mean business.
Zukovsky, on the point of being swallowed by the caviar, clawing at the crate.  Bond, steely eyed, cold:
Now...where were we?
A rope!
No.  The truth! (beat)
She thought I was dead -- those blades were meant for you.  What do you know that she would kill you for? Zukovsky is sinking.
I don't know what you're talking -- Zukovsky sees Christmas appear beside Bond:
Help me, don't let me drown. She looks to Bond -- sees he's serious.
(to Zukovsky)
You're in this thing up to your neck. Zukovsky sinks alarmingly -- he talks rapidly, staccato:
Alright, alright!  Sometimes I smuggle machinery for her.  Russian stuff.
And the payoff on the tables?
A special job.  A...a...a submarine.
What?
To haul some cargo. My nephew, he is Captain of a sub in the Black Sea Fleet.
Where's the sub going?!
No!  Get me out!
This is too big for even you.  Where is it?
This is a family matter! If my nephew is in danger, we do it my way, or nothing! Now get me out! But he looks more worried than ever as Bond takes aim wit the harpoon gun -- squeezes the trigger.
No! Bond!
(alarmed)

Bond! Bond fires.  Zukovsky YELLS as the HARPOON SHOOTS TOWARD It takes him a moment to realize he hasn't been hit -- th harpoon splintering the crate, just missing him.  He clin to the crate, exhausted, as Bond and Christmas drag him t safety.
Commander Bond, you are dangerous, unpredictable, and a hothead. He just looks at her.

But then again, explosive devices are my specialty. Zukovsky scowls, wet, angry, looking from his ruined suit the devastation that was once his caviar factory as, behi him, walkways CREAK, teeter, and CRASH into the sea.
So.  My way.  No MI-6, no Interpol.  Just you, me and my people.
Where?
Istanbul.

Beyond iron balustrades we see one of the most fabulous v in the world -- on one side the still waters of the Golde Horn, on the other, the dancing waves of the unsheltered Bosphorus -- and in between, the tumbling roofs, soaring minarets and crouching mosques of the Pera district. RENARD scans the water with night-vision binoculars.
A SUPERTANKER churns along...

The CAMERA SINKS BENEATH THE WAVES, steals through the gl - eventually comes upon something sitting just beneath th belly of the tanker.  The silhouette of a SUBMARINE, hugg the tanker's shadow, creeping undetected into the Bosphorus...

M paces her cell.  Looks out, at the clock: It is MIDNIGHT.  Twelve hours to go. She crosses her arms.  Returns to pacing.  Puts her hands her coat pockets: She feels something.  Takes it out. THE LOCATOR CARD.  Black and shiny, with two copper termi on one end. M taps it on her hand. She looks back out.  TO THE CLOCK.
Renard and Elektra.  She is on the bed, Renard stroking h worshipping her skin.
So beautiful. So smooth, so warm.
How would you know? It stings him. Elektra sits up, pulling a robe around her
Why are you like this?  Because Bond is dead?  It's what you wanted.
(beat)
Of course... Renard gets up.  Paces the floor.
He was a...good lover?

What do you think? Renard leans against her desk, closing his eyes, squeezin out the images.  After a moment, he SMASHES HIS FIST thro the hand-painted wood.  Elektra looks up. HER P.O.V.  A huge splinter of wood juts out of Renard's hand. Renard looks at it, curious, unfazed.
Nothing. Elektra comes to him. Leads him to the bed.  Sits. Gently removes the splinter.  Then, she takes an icecube from th bucket.  Runs it along his wound.
What about this? And she runs the ice down his cheek.  He shakes his head. Tormented.
Nothing. Now she runs the ice down her neck...
But surely... ...her fingers becoming wet, she runs the ice down betwee her breasts, leaving a trail.  Teasing...
...You can feel this? She's moving the ice lower on herself... We see her lips open, enjoying the sensation.  A beat, then his smile slo grows.  As she does something else.
(sensual)
Remember ... pleasure?
Eerily quiet.  The calm before the storm, except:

M is at the door of her cell.  Her arm is stretched out through the bars.  She is using her high-heeled shoe to t to HOOK the leg of the stool and drag it toward her.  She only jut tap the leg with the tip of the heel.  She swipe out at the little three-legged stool, tapping it, tapping it... It scoots toward her a little...she taps it again, gets h shoe HOOKED on the leg of the stool and starts to drag it when... The rickety stool hits a bump on the ancient stone floor SPILLS OVER...the clock HITS THE GROUND and SKIDS across stones, coming to rest ACROSS THE ROOM, on the floor near window. M leans against the bars. SHE HEARS HER THE OUTER DOOR CLANKING OPEN... She hurries to her cot and lies down. GABOR ENTERS...a burly shadow in the light from the hall. walks in.  Looks at M.  Picks up the clock and sets it ON WINDOW SILL. He leaves, shutting the door behind him. M sits up. Looks out to the clock, glowing in the dark. IT READS TWO A.M. She drops her head back on the wall.  She will not sleep tonight.
ESTABLISH the vast city astride the Bosphorus.
The sun starting to rise.  Street vendors are the only pe about, moving their carts into place, getting ready to pl out their wares.  We hold on a BUILDING.

A multi-levelled, rickety old building full of colourful fabrics drying high overhead; the light shafts through th casting pools of different coloured light. It is a working factory, bolts of fabric and vats of dye, it is also:

Pushed to one end of the large room are stacks of radio equipment, old consoles, audio equipment and radar screen Once a high-tech surveillance center, it has gone to seed There are men and women here, smoking, using the equipmen slightly dissolute, very sinister, where the only members card is an old KGB ID.  Zukovsky is here, leaning behind RADIO OPERATOR.
Any luck reaching Yevgeny?
Negative, comrade. He moves to CHRISTMAS AND BOND, pouring over a large MAP ISTANBUL spread out on a table.
(to Zukovsky)
What is this place?
Former KGB surveillance post. The Dye Factory was just a front; now it turns a good profit. Bond notices THE BOA in the corner with some others.
Your old friend Dmitri. Zukovsky nods to his old friend.
Today, you are glad to have the Boa  on your side. Zukovsky looks at the map.
In the good old days, the KGB had three or four spots where our submarines could surface without anyone knowing. But Yevgeny is supposed to be loading cargo.
What class sub does your nephew run?
C-class.
Nuclear.
Not just nuclear. Powered by a nuclear reactor. (the penny drops)
He's not loading any cargo. They want the sub. The sub itself. Put weapons grade plutonium inside the sub's reactor: Instant, catastrophic meltdown.
Made to look just like an accident.
Mother of God.
The right kind of explosion in the right spot -- it would block the Bosphorus, cut off the Black Sea.
But why? Eight million people would die, the land irradiated for a hundred years. A cloud of radiation the size of Europe...
(chilled)
Because an explosion like that would kill all the other pipelines. There would be only one way to get the oil out of the Caspian and pump it to the world...
The King pipeline.
Elektra would control it all.
If what you say it true...it may be too late for Yevgeny.
The ancient arched underbelly of a waterside building. Something is disturbing a large expanse of water.  A blac shadow looms beneath the waves.  A SUBMARINE SURFACES.
Waiting at the newly excavated quay:  Renard and his men. The submarine's hatch opens.  A YOUTHFUL CAPTAIN EMERGES, vaguely resembling his uncle, Zukovsky.
Captain...
Sir. We are ready to load your cargo. We only have a few hours before we'll be missed.
You came with a skeleton crew?
That's all we can afford these days.
Of course. We are grateful for your efforts. One of his men comes forward with several bottles of bran and other food.
We have brandy and other refreshments for your men. The Captain nods, pleased.
Bond and Christmas and Zukovsky watch as the radio operat scan the airwaves.
If we're not in time and something has happened to him... you must let me kill them. Bond stares hard at him.  A long beat.
Whoever gets there first, Zukovsky.  They have M.
Eerie, dark, the lights inside green and sickly.
A half-eaten sandwich. An empty glass of brandy on the fl just near the hand it fell from...
The dead face of Yevgeny, poisoned.  Others of his crew around, also dead. Renard and his men tour the grisly scene.
Take them up and throw them in the sea. As they drag Yevgeny away, his HAT falls on the ground. Renard picks it up and PUTS IT ON HIS HEAD.

We'll be underway in two hours.  Use that time to re-familiarize yourselves with your stations. Then ponder how rich you'll be.  The re-breathers for the escape are already on board. A man appears holding a heavy lead box containing the plutonium.  Renard takes the box as if it weighs nothing. Stronger then ever.
Elektra stands at the door looking in at M.
Now you know how it feels.  To be locked away, to wonder if they're coming for you, if anyone will ever come for you.
Someone will come.
Who?  Bond?  Bond is dead. Elektra walks to the window.  She looks out.
Somehow, I find that strangely ...disappointing. M watches her, her heart beating.
Elektra. What time is it? Elektra picks up the little clock. Walks over to the cell bars.
Time for you to die. And she reaches through the bars and HANDS M THE CLOCK. The two women's eyes meet.
The reactor is secured. She turns, sees RENARD in the doorway.  She crosses to hi and SLAMS THE DOOR SHUT behind her.
Their eyes lock.
This is the end.
No.  It is the beginning. The world will never be the same. He lays the Captain's hat down. Tries to mask his sorrow.
It will be yours, and yours alone. Have fun with it. Forces himself to leave, heads down the stairs.
M works quickly.  She pops open the back of the clock and takes out the batteries.  She pries off the tops with a k and connects the wires to the LOCATOR CARD...
The Radio Operator touches his earpiece...
Comrade, it's faint, but I'm getting something. A signal. Transmitting at...37- 19 degrees north... He writes the coordinates down.  Bond picks them up.
The locator card. It's M. He takes the coordinates over to the map and DRAWS A CORRESPONDING LINE across it.
The rest? Christmas reads them out as the Operator writes them down
Forty, forty-three degrees East... Bond draws another line across the map. At the point at w the intersect...a small island in the Bosphorus.
The Maiden's Tower.
How appropriate.

I'd heard there were some renovations there...no one would look for a sub in that place in a million years. Suddenly Bond's instinct are aroused.  Out of the corner his eye, he sees THE BOA set something on the ground and slowly UP THE STAIRS. Bond looks at the pack he left on the ground... He grabs Christmas and HURLS HER TO THE FLOOR.

A MASSIVE EXPLOSION rips the place apart.  In half a seco the air is thick with coloured dust and drifting clumps o burning silk. Bond stands.  Christmas is stunned, but okay.  He looks around at the others - few dead, all out for the count, a them, Zukovsky. Bond heads for the door after the Boa.
Zukovsky...
If I don't get to the Boa before he gets to Maiden's Tower, M is dead. Bond runs out, into

Teeming with people, his eyes scanning, he spots...THE BO climbing a ladder alongside a building to A ROOF. Bond chases after him, clambering up, but when he gets to top of the roof... Boa has now been joined by THREE THUGS.  One attacks Bond the Boa and the others move away... Bond fights with the thug, they stumble across the roof, gripping each other, until Bond gets the upper hand and THROWS HIM DOWN through a thatched roof where he falls...

Into the market below. Christmas, just coming into the square, sees the body falling...she runs to the thug, thinking it might be Bond But the thug raises up, smiling at her, blood on his teet She turns and runs...the thug gives chase...
Bond is following Boa and the other two men as they LEAP roof to roof. He sees them jump off onto the roof of...

Motoring rapidly away from him.  He makes a spectacular l to a wobbly FLAG POLE that swings him toward the bus, dropping him on the roof before it SNAPS BACK, into the overhead TRAM WIRES ABOVE and setting off sparks.

Bond barely gets to his feet before Thug #2 is upon him. They grapple, struggling to maintain their footing as the speeds through the rickety old streets. He throws the guy over... The thug desperately CLINGS TO THE SIDE OF THE BUS... Bond now takes on the third thug, unaware that number two climbed back on and is about to WHACK HIM ON THE HEAD wit his gun when... THE BUS TURNS onto a new street...THE WIRES AGAIN...Thug Two's gun is caught up in them...he is instantly ELECTROCUTED. Thug three watches his friend's horrible death, giving Bo time to slug him hard across the face and THROW HIM FROM BUS...
Thug two's body goes SLAMMING INTO THE WINDSHIELD of a fa moving van...BURSTS OUT through the back doors of said va and tumbles out onto the street where it is HIT BY A CAR.

Bond turns back toward...BOA. Now it is just the two of t The bus is hissing to a stop. The Boa leaps on to the bed of a passing truck.  Bond rus forward and leaps on to the top of a passing taxi.  The t jams on his breaks and Bond rolls across the bonnet and o the street.  He springs to his feet. Fifty yards ahead the truck carrying the Boa has stopped traffic.  The Boa jumps out and darts into an alley.

The Alley leads into a small CAFE where PATRONS smoke wat pipes and drink coffee.  The Boa is nowhere to be seen. Bond slips out his gun holding it out of sight close to h leg so as not to alarm the civilians.  He steps into the cafe.

Bond makes his way through the tables to the doorway in t back.  He looks inside - just a few children  at play.  B is suddenly blind-sided by a vicious kidney punch which brings him to his knees.  He struggles to bring up his gu but the Boa knocks it out of his hand. The Boa locks Bond's head in an unbreakable choke hold fr behind.  Bond pulls on the massive arms - but to no avail He glances down to his right - HIS GUN - just out of reac Bond reaches out for it - his fingers just graze it. Suddenly the Boa's foot kicks out, knocking the gun acros the room.  He tighten his grip and speaks in Bond's ear.

For years I was told I could never take the great James Bond and his Walther PPK. What good is your gun now, Bond? Bond can't breathe, his eyes start to dim.  He slumps forward, his left hand touches something hot.  It's the i basket of coals used to keep the water pipes lite.  Bond' fingers touch the wire handle that arches across the top. grabs it and with his last reserves - Swings it at the back of his head hitting the Boa on the of the head with the SOUND OF RAW BACON HITTING A HOT SKILLET. The Boa drops Bond and leaps to his feet holding the side his face.  Bond falls forward fighting for breath and try to clear his head. The Boa runs out the back door.  Bond finds his gun, hols it and follows.
Bond comes out into a side street crowded with VENDERS AN SHOPPERS.  Bond sees the Boa pushing his way through the crowd to...

RUSSIAN TRAMP STEAMER taking on cargo.  Bond enters squar time to see the Boa making a Bee line for the Russian steamer. As the Boa, much the worse-for-ware, starts up the gangwa the top deck of the steamer, Bond hitches a ride on a car net that is being hoisted aboard by the ship's boom.

Boa, breathing hard gets to the deck.  He lumbers across but before he can reach the other side he is tripped up b Bond who has been waiting for him by the side of the deck house.  The Boa goes sprawling.  As Bond comes for him he scrambles to his feet, grabs a nearby bailing hook, and swings at Bond.  But Bond is ready for him.  He wards off blow with a small wooden cover from a shipping crate.  He traps the Boa's arm and gives him two quick devastating k in the solar plexus.  He Boa stages back to the railing. final kick from Bond sends him over the side...

head_text.subj: THE BOA FALLS, LANDING ON HIS BACK ON THE DECK BELOW WITH

text: Bond looks down, sees the Boa's body at a horrible angle, neck broken. Bond sighs, turns... GABOR is there. Gun trained on him.
Welcome aboard, Mr. Bond. BOND'S P.O.V.  A thug steps into sight below, holding CHRISTMAS hostage as well.

A magnificent ornate tower in the centre of the Bosphorus An innocent-looking launch coasts up to it.  A tarp is ra and Bond and Christmas are revealed, hands bound.  They a helped out, led inside by a number of henchmen.
Elektra crosses the hallway as the doors open.  Kisses Bo on the cheek as she eyes Christmas.

James Bond and his amazing resurrection. If only you'd kept away, we might have met again in a few years, become lovers once more. Christmas eyes Bond anew as Elektra leads him to an ornat carved chair, covered in silk.
(to guards)

Take her to Renard. Bond and Christmas exchange a look as the guards start he towards some steps. Elektra indicates for him to sit.  Behind him, the whole Istanbul is visible through a large curved window.
Pretty thing.  You had her too? Bond ignores her.
I could have given you the world.
Not interested. This cuts. She casually reaches behind his neck, flips up wooden arm to which is attached a metal collar.  A GAROTT
They were digging near here and they found some very pretty vases.  They also found this... (meaning the garotte)
I think we ignore the old ways at our peril, don't you? Bond recoils as she fastens the collar...  She steps back
(ignoring her)
Where's M?
Soon she'll be everywhere. Bond keeps his cool:
All this, because you fell for Renard?

Five more turns and your neck will break. She moves to the back of the chair, twists the screw ONE NOTCH.  The effect on Bond is instantaneous as a bolt jol into the back of his neck, tilts his head back.
Since I was a child, I've always had a power over men. When I realized my father wouldn't rescue me from the kidnappers, I knew I had to form a new alliance.
(realizing)
You turned Renard.
(smiling)
Just like you...only you were even easier. She pulls the jewel from her ear, reveals the ugly scar:
I told him he had to hurt me, he had to make it look real. When he refused I told him I would do it myself. She turns the screw again.
So you killed your father.
He killed me! He killed me the day he refused to pay my ransom. A flicker of emotion.  Bond is getting to her.
Was this all about the oil?
It is my oil!  Mine and my family's! Her eyes are shining.  She moves toward the view, gazing at this spectacular cradle of civilization.  Bond works h wristbinds feverishly.
It runs in my veins, thicker than blood. I'm going to redraw the map. And when I am through the whole world will know my name, my grandfather's name, the glory of my people.
No-one will believe this melt-down was an accident. She eyes him, impressed that he's worked out her plan. Tightens the screw again.  Her confidence amazing.
They will believe.  They will all believe. Tightening the screw again:
You understand? Nobody can resist me. Now she straddles him.  She puts the jewel back on her ea All the time, he's working that wristbind.
Know what happens when a man is strangled?
Elektra, it's not too late.  Eight million people needn't die. She smiles, twists the screw again.  A nasty, grinding so Sweat trickles from his brow.  She licks it away.

You should have killed me when you had the chance.  But you couldn't. Not me.  A woman you've loved. She pushes her hips into his.  Turns the screw.  The bolt jammed right into the back of his neck.  His face is angl upwards.  Breathing is difficult.  He glares up:
You meant ... nothing ... to me. She fingers the bolt.  Prepares to turn it the last time...His hand strains at its binding...
One... last... screw?
(kissing his ear)
Oh James. She begins to turn the screw... ... when SEVERAL GUNSHOTS are heard outside. Bond is on the edge of consciousness. Elektra freezes.  Gets off him.  Moves to a window.

Big, battered and bloody, Valentin Zukovsky is leaving a boat, moving over the rocks toward the entrance with thre his men.  Two bodies in his trail.  He's on course for Elektra and nothing is going to stop him, even as his henchmen are cut down by ferocious fire.

Elektra moves to her gun.  Just then, Gabor crashes throu stained glass window, neck broken. TWO ELEKTRA HENCHMEN appear from below stairs as the door burst open.  Zukovsky stands there.  A bloody giant. They open up with machine guns, but two shots from Zukovs take them out, though he takes one in the shoulder.  Righ now, he's unstoppable. A shocked silence after the shooting.  He eyes Bond in th chair.  To the room:
I'm looking for a submarine.  It's big and black, and the driver is a friend of mine. Then his eye falls on the HAT Renard had brought up from below.  He knows at once what it means.
Bring it to me. She picks it up, walks to him (surreptitiously sliding a beneath it).  She proffers the hat...

What a shame.  You just missed him. BLAM BLAM BLAM -- she fires through the hat. He staggers back.  Stares.  Slumps down.  Lowers his head the ground. She walks over, puts her heel on his gun arm, presses dow smiling a half-psychotic smile.  The gun is pinned. Zukovsky is dying. But he dredges up every last ounce of energy to raise his a millimetre off the ground, his outstretched arm already pointing at Bond. Elektra looks surprised, then amused as Zukovsky's finger begins to squeeze the trigger:  he's go to shoot Bond! Bond stares back.  Zukovsky's eye narrows -- trying for extreme accuracy... BLAM! The SHOT hits the binding at Bond's wrist.  Splinte the wood there. ELEKTRA stares at Zukovsky.  She didn't see where the bul went, just that it missed Bond.  She watches his head slu further, staring at Bond... A look passes between the two men.  Comrades in arms.  Th merest of smiles.  Then the light fades from his eyes.  D
turns back to Bond.  Smiles.
Excuse me. She picks up a walkie-talkie, speaks into it:
Everything's under control up here.  Are you ready?
(filtered)
Yes.  Au revoir... Lost for a moment, she breathes heavily.  She glances at Zukovsky's corpse.  Slightly puzzled, to Bond:
Zukovsky really hated you. (beat)

Time to say goodnight. And she kisses him -- reaches behind to deliver the kille twist... One super-fast movement: Bond's hand breaks free, grabs her throat, tight.  He hol her, their faces close together, disdain in his eyes -- h her backwards, her hand scratching at his face. Ripping the collar from his neck, he gets to his feet.  M to Zukovsky, checks his pulse, takes the bloody gun from fingers. Turns back, to see Elektra disappearing upstairs.  A mome dilemma:  should he race below to the sub -- or up to Elektra? He takes off after Elektra, grabs the radio handset.
The submarine's engines roar to life.
ELEKTRA rises up one of the triple spiral stairways leadi to the various balconies of the minaret tower.
Bond stalks up after her.  THEIR VOICES ECHO through the intertwined stairs:

James.  You can't kill me.  Not in cold blood. But Bond isn't wavering.  Clutches Zukovsky's bloody wet He heads up in the semi-darkness -- and suddenly swings t his right, at an unexpected but familiar Voice:
Bond -- Bond kicks open a door and enters...
He fires at the lock on her cell door and frees her. Turn go, heading upward, after Elektra.
Go after the submarine, forget the girl. Bond!
Elektra has reached a balcony.  It affords a spectacular of Istanbul.  Bond appears, has her cornered.
Call him off. He holds the walkie-talkie to her mouth.
I won't ask again.  Call him off! She looks at him seriously.  He's giving her a last chanc willing her to save herself and the city.
(into walkie-talkie)
Renard. Bond waits...
(to Bond)
You wouldn't kill me.  You'd miss me. And her face breaks into a perverted grin and --
(into walkie-talkie)
Dive!  Bond -- BLAM!  Bond shoots her. She staggers back, shocked at her own mortality.
I never miss. He looks out:
Sees the nose of the sub heading into the Bosphorus, half submerged.  The hatch is still open.
He stares at her dead body a beat. And then, he crouches. touches her cheek, just once, before he goes. Behind him, unbeknownst, M has seen it all.
He moves to the ledge. Composes himself -- and DIVES ONE HUNDRED FEET to the water.  Amazing.

He surfaces close to the exiting sub.  Grabs a ladder, pu himself up. The hatch is closing...  He splashes through the water flooding over the sub, appears in front of the amazed sai shutting the hatch.  WHACKS him with the hatch.  Gets ins Closes it.  Milliseconds before the hatch slides under th water.
Bond down below. Renard's crew are spread throughout the He creeps through... Approaches one man working some levers, smoking.  Bond ho his gun to his head.
How do you want to die? (re:  cigarette)
That? (re:  gun)
Or this?
A few SOLID BANGS on the metal of Christmas' door.  It op and Bond lets the now unconscious man hit the deck.  That his head banging.
(stunned)
James!... He takes her by the hand, they move through the shadows o the sub.
A man is operating the tanks.  Through the intercom:
(filtered)
Flood tanks 4 and 5... The man does as told.  When he's finished -- Bond knocks out with the butt of his gun.
Several men occupy the central control room, Renard at th centre.  Beyond, on the other side, the outer chamber of reactor.
From the other end of the control room, Bond and Christma so near and yet so far -- they can't get to the reactor because there are so many men in there. Keeping behind cover:
Is there another way?
We go down to the torpedo bay.

location: TANK CONTROLS ROOM, SUBMARINE LOWER DECK

text: Bond and Christmas get attacked.  A vicious, silent fight Then the radio set sparks into life --
Open the tanks. Bond is throttling the man with the cable.  Speaks into t handset.
(disguising voice)
Tanks open. But the man has stretched his hand to a fire alarm: The KLAXON RESOUNDS.
Renard looks up.
(to self)
Bond... He flicks a switch;
(into mic)
Bond! You have decided to join me on this historic voyage.  Welcome to my nuclear family.
His voice fills the control room.
You're really going to commit suicide for her? Renard responds, into the microphone.
In case you've forgotten.  I'm dead already.

Haven't you heard the news?  So is she. Renard's face screws up in pain more searing than any he could feel in his skin...he SCREAMS... INT. SUBMARINE... The scream, like a wounded animal, echoes throughout the doomed craft. BACK ON RENARD, gasping, spent.
You will die for this. He strides through to the
Jams shut the hatch behind him.  Now moves through to the
Where he picks up the PLUTONIUM. Moves back into the
Sealing the other door behind him.  And now he opens up t cover of the glaring REACTOR...
Christmas sees a panel light up:
The cover is off the reactor. Bond reads off more lights...
He's sealed himself in.
He's going to insert the plutonium. Thinking fast, Bond moves to some controls.  Hits switche
Do you know what you're doing?
Like riding a bike.
The air tanks immediately filling with water.
Christmas and Bond shift to the side.  Everything not scr down starts sliding...
The submarine is tilting, further and further, the nose dropping down and down... Pretty soon we have the strange and incredible sight of a submarine hanging vertically, nose down.
Renard hangs on, swings, until he can get a footing on th nearest wall.
Bond and Christmas hang on too, get a grip.  He helps her
What kind of bikes did you ride?
Just wanted to put him on edge...
Renard is disturbed by the sub's position, but only momentarily. He moves to an intercom:
Open the torpedo tubes.
Bond hears a creak, turns to see the tubes open -- water gushes up toward them at an incredible rate.
Climb! He pulls Christmas up and they ascend to the next level. chance to seal the chamber though, the water is already through the hatch.
Keep moving.
Renard now struggles back up to the reactor, stares into violet blue heat... He hits a button.  A ROD slowly rises out of the reactor.
Bond and Christmas are ahead of the water.  They have rea a level where various systems are operated from.
There's one chance. He punches buttons.
High up on the sub, a hatch opens.  Water floods into an escape hatch.  An inner door stops it getting into the submarine itself.
Renard slowly inserts the plutonium rod.  Immediately the light around him becomes a deeper blue, a horrible luminescence.  The staccato click of a distant Geiger cou intensifies.
As Bond opens the inner door of an ESCAPE HATCH, he point out a cabinet on the wall to Christmas.
Re-breathers. She opens the box to find the RE-BREATHERS are ripped to shreds.  No-one was ever meant to get off the sub.  She s Bond.
Never liked those things anyway. He climbs into the escape chamber.
Count to twenty.  When you get to twenty open the hatch.  It can only be opened for a few seconds or we'll sink.
But what if...
Count to twenty.  I'll be there. She moves over and seals the door, wrenches a lever which immediately floods the chamber with water.
Inside the chamber, Bond holds his breath as water seeps The most claustrophobic thing you've ever seen.
A green light comes on and Christmas punches a button...
The OUTER DOOR opens...  Bond burst out and starts the lo swim up the OUTSIDE OF THE SUBMARINE...
Christmas is counting.
One, one thousand, two, one thousand...
It's dark out here.  It would be very easy for Bond to ge disoriented. He peers around, trying to get his bearings against the v vertical whale he's swimming up. Passes the conning tower.
Fourteen, one thousand, fifteen, one thousand...
Bond is running out of air... And then he sees it -- the open hatch of the rear escape door. He gets inside, yanks it closed...
Christmas, shivering in the rising water.
Twenty. She presses a button...
The hatch opens and Bond collapses out in a gush of water The hatch closes. The whole world is at a crazy angle here. Bond looks down the sealed door of the reactor chamber, curses.

Bathed in the horrible light of the over-heating reactor, Renard looks upwards, aware of sounds on the other side o the door... KER-BLAM!  A BLINDING FLASH OF LIGHT. The door shoots off its hinge, blasted by Bond. Bond drops down into the chamber, takes one look at Renar now a crumpled heap in the corner. Bond moves down to the next door, opens it:
Christmas! And there she is, struggling, the water level way below s rising... He lowers an arm, pulls her up. They clamber up to the reactor:
BOND'S POV: in the intense glow inside -- the overheating rod, protruding slightly.
We have to get the rod out of the reactor!
Bond looks at the gauges from behind a thick GLASS SHIELD Christmas comes up level with him:

Melting down.  4000 degrees, the Zirconium casings on the rods crack. 5000, the plutonium melts.  In ten minutes, a hydrogen explosion. THE TEMPERATURE GAUGE READS 4500 AND RISING... He starts toward the reactor when suddenly RENARD IS BEHIND BOND, THROTTLING HIM. CHRISTMAS grabs at him, is flung back, nearly falls throu the hatch but manages to grab a pipe, hangs on for dear l
struggle...  Both slamming into switches and buttons.

head_text.subj: THE GAUGE IS PASSING 4900, EDGING TOWARDS THE NO-WAY-BACK

text: 5000 MARK.  Meltdown imminent... He looks down the sub -- more water racing upward... Back to the pile.  Scans the scene, searching for an idea Sees a HOSE, compressed air escaping from a fissure.  Thi fast.  Grabs the hose, snaps it free...
is recovering, has found a FLARE GUN near him.  Raises it Bond...

in the reflection of the gauge (which is millimeters from 5000), we see Renard approaching from behind us... BOND jams the hose into the reactor, ducks down -- as the blows the rod out - narrowly missing him as it shoots pas impales Renard in the heart, just before he could shoot. Renard stares at Bond in horror.  Bond calmly takes the f gun off him.

She's waiting for you. And he lets him fall past Christmas, through consecutive hatches of the sub, crashing into the rising water. Christmas looks down at the floating corpse. Bond watches the gauge -- as it edges DOWN from 5000. The nuclear disaster looks like it's averted.  But sudden water is gushing in from above, through splits in the sub shell; it's going to sink.
We're sinking. But she won't come.  As water courses over them:
Help me.  We have to seal it. She moves to the reactor, closing the cover.  Bond uses h strength to push the heavy locking mechanism into place. Bond climbs upwards, dragging Christmas with him.
We've got to get out.
We can't.
They clamber into the next chamber up...
The submarine is slowly sinking, nose down.  Air is escap from the many seams that are creeping apart.  We can hear metallic GROANS through the water.
Bond and Christmas crawl into TORPEDO CHAMBERS... Bond reaches out, setting a timer to FIRE... The clock ticks down...
The Torpedo doors open and Bond and Christmas are SHOT OU INTO THE WATER, streaking through, as behind them... THE SUBMARINE EXPLODES in spectacular fashion.
Bond and Christmas reach the surface...  Look around them No boats coming to the rescue.  They wave to a tourist bo passing. The boat heads over to pick them up...
The damaged wing is being repaired.

Tanner overseeing things, and then... M walks in.  Efficient and steely as ever.  All eyes turn her.  She looks at everyone...makes the briefest of nods. That is all the sentiment allowed as business resumes. She scans the machines:
Any word from him?
Still no contact yet.
A magnificent rooftop garden looking out over Istanbul. Christmas and Bond alone with some Bollinger. FIREWORKS explode above. They clink glasses.  He looks ou the cityscape.
I love Christmas in Turkey.
So isn't it time you unwrapped your present?
Tanner and Q look at a SATELLITE THERMAL IMAGE OF ISTANBU
That's strange. The satellite image zooms in one particular car parked in side street.  We can just make out Bond's ASTON MARTIN.
He must be nearby. M comes over. The image moves from the car, closes on the garden roofto The thermal image is multi-coloured, difficult to deciphe
Where?
This picks up body heat.  Humans should be orange. (searching)
There. And he points to ONE orange figure lying on the rooftop.
(to Tanner)
I thought you said he was with Doctor Jones? They all look back to the image.  The figure is turning R almost glowing.
It's getting redder. Tanner, Q and M realize as one that this is an image of t people, one atop the other.  And getting hotter.
Bond. Q switches the screen off, clears his throat.
Could be a premature form of the Millennium Bug.
It's dark, we can't really see them.
You know James...  I think Christmas is coming early this year.
